loans.use: to purchase a greater quantity of cassava and maize, thus increasing her current inventory levels.

loans.name: Ama

texts.en:
Even though Ama grew up in poverty without an education, this has not stopped her from fulfilling her dream of achieving a better life for herself and her family. Currently, Ama is an entrepreneur. She prepares and sells plain rice and ‘Wakye’ (a traditional Ghanaian dish made primarily from beans, rice and colored leaves) for a living. She primarily sells her ‘Wakye’ in Dompoase (near Cape Coast). Her business enterprise has grown substantially since she began seven months ago. She uses the income from her business to help her husband raise their seven children. 

Ama has identified that there are growing demands among consumers for her ‘Wakye’. However, she is unable to meet their needs due to a limited inventory capacity. Thus she aims to use her loan to purchase a greater quantity of rice and beans, therefore helping her to prepare more of her tasty ‘Wakye’. With the new profits from her expanded business, Ama wants to buck the trend by ensuring that all her children will be given the opportunity to further distance their family from poverty.

loans.use: to purchase a greater quantity of rice and beans, therefore helping her to prepare more of her tasty ‘Wakye’.

loans.name: Aba

texts.en:
Due to difficult circumstances, Aba did not have access to any kind of formal education, yet this has not stopped her from achieving her dream of becoming an entrepreneur. Currently, Aba prepares and sells kenkey, a traditional Ghanaian dish made from corn dough and wrapped in banana leaves, in her village of Wakrom (near Cape Coast). She has been doing so for about four years. She is married to a farmer, and together they have six children. Aba uses all her income to feed and provide for her family. 

Aba will use the loan to purchase a greater amount of maize, which will aid her in improving her overall kenkey sales. Aba wants to use the future profits from her expanded business to ensure that all her children are able to receive an education.

loans.use: to purchase a greater amount of maize to increase her sales of the traditional dish she makes.

loans.name: Araba

texts.en: Even though Araba  grew up in poverty without an education, this has not stopped her from fulfilling her dream of achieving a better life for her and her family. Currently, Araba is an entrepreneur who sells food stuffs like cassava, plantain, and palm fruits. She also prepares and sells ‘Kenkey’ (a traditional Ghanaian dish made from corn dough and wrapped in banana leaves) for a living . She primarily sells her ‘Kenkey’ in Wakrom (near Cape Coast). Her business enterprise has grown substantially since she began four years ago. She uses the income from her business to help her husband in their general up keep.  Araba  has identified that there are growing demands among consumers for her ‘Kenkey’. Nevertheless she is unable to meet their needs due to a limited inventory capacity. Thus she aims to use her loan to purchase a greater quantity of maize, which will help her to prepare more of her tasty ‘Kenkey’. With the new profits from her expanded business,  Araba wants to buck the trend by ensuring that all her children will be given the opportunity to further distance their family from poverty.

loans.use: to purchase a greater quantity of maize, which will help her to prepare more of her tasty ‘Kenkey’.

loans.name: Comfort

texts.en:
Comfort is a widow and has two children. Even though she did not receive any formal education, Comfort is a successful businesswoman. She sells food items, including vegetables and fish, in Wakrom (near Cape Coast). She has been actively involved in this business for about four years. As the sole breadwinner in the family, Comfort uses her income to provide for the entire family.

Comfort will use the loan to purchase greater amounts of vegetables, fish and other food items, thus helping her to improve her overall sales. With the new profits from her expanded business, Comfort plans to further diversify the type of products that she sells, hence adapting to changing customer preferences.

loans.use: to purchase a greater amount of food items to improve her overall sales.

loans.name: Ama

texts.en:
Ama is a small-scale baker who bakes bread and sells it in Wakrom (near Cape Coast). She has had some form of formal education as she is a primary graduate. She is married and has six children. Her husband is a carpenter. Ama has been working as a baker for close to four years. Her income is used to help her husband pay the utility bills and their children’s school fees. 

Ama plans on using her loan to purchase a greater quantity of bread, thus allowing her to meet rising customer demand. She hopes to use the profits from her enterprise to fulfill her dream of buying a bread stand, hence helping her sell from a fixed location in the future.

loans.use: to purchase a greater quantity of bread to meet rising customer demand.

loans.name: Rebecca

texts.en: Due to difficult circumstances, Rebecca did not have access to any form of formal education, yet this has not stopped her from achieving her dream of becoming an entrepreneur. Currently, Rebecca prepares and sells kenkey (a traditional Ghanaian dish made from corn dough wrapped in banana leaves) in her village of Wakrom, near Cape Coast. She has been in this business for about two years. Rebecca is married to a farmer, and together they have five children. Rebecca uses all her income to feed and provide for her family. Rebecca will use this loan to purchase an increased amount of maize, which will help her improve her overall kenkey sales. Rebecca wants to use the future profits from her expanded business to ensure that all her children are able to receive an education.

loans.use: to purchase an increased amount of maize, which will help her improve her overall ‘kenkey’ sales.

loans.name: Aba

texts.en:
Although she has received no formal education, Aba is an entrepreneur. She specializes in preparing and selling gari, a traditional Ghanaian snack that is made from starched powdered cassava. She usually sells her gari in Wakrom (near Cape Coast). She has been involved in preparing and selling gari for ten years. 

Aba is married and has five children. Her husband works as a farmer. The proceeds from her business normally go toward helping her husband cover the family’s general expenses and pay their children’s school fees.  

Aba wants to use her loan to purchase a greater quantity of cassava, thus increasing her current inventory levels. This will allow her to sell greater quantities of her tasty gari. In the long term, Aba plans to reinvest the future profits back into her business, thus helping her expand and meet rising customer demand.

loans.use: to purchase a greater quantity of cassava to increase her production of a traditional snack

loans.name: Iris Arely

texts.es:
Doña Iris es una señora muy emprendedora con muchas ganas de salir adelante de 33 años de edad la cual comparte hogar junto a su esposo y sus dos hijos la mayor de 17 años la cual estudia su primer año en la secundaria la carrera de administración de empresas la cual también al salir de sus actividades estudiantiles ayuda con las diferentes actividades en el hogar y en el campo. Doña Iris aprendió el rubro y oficio de la agricultura gracias a sus padres ya que desde muy pequeña los apoyaba en el mantenimiento de café. Sus cultivos están ubicados en su misma comunidad a la cual se trasladan caminando aproximadamente a una media hora y la tierra que cultiva es propia gracias a una herencia por parte de sus padres. Doña Iris tiene un grado de educación primaria completo el cual pudo cursar gracias al apoyo brindado por sus padres pero no pudo continuar ya que la economía en su hogar no era la mejor.

Ella sueña con ver a sus hijas en un mejor futuro, con mejores oportunidades, mejores condiciones de vida para que puedan ser apoyo en sus familias aportando todo lo necesario. por lo que ella hoy en día solicita un financiamiento con el cual mejorara sus cultivos dando una mejor asistencia aplicando insumos agrícolas como abono, fertilizantes, formula cafetalera, fungicidas que evitaran la contaminación de bichos y enfermedades.
texts.en:
Iris, 33, is a very enterprising woman who wants to move forward. She lives with her husband and their two children. The oldest is 17 and is in her first year of secondary school studying for a career in business administration. In addition to school activities, she helps with the various chores at home and in the field. Iris learned agricultural skills from her parents. From a very young age, she helped attend to the coffee plants. Her crops are located in her community, about a half hour walk away. The land she uses is her own thanks to an inheritance from her parents. Iris completed one grade of primary school education. She was able to go to school because of her parent's support but she wasn't able to continue further because her family's economic situation wasn't the best.

Her dream is to see her daughters have a better future with better opportunities and a better quality of life so they can support their families in everything they need. Therefore, she is requesting a loan today to improve her crops by better attending to them. She will use agricultural supplies such as compost, fertilizers, a coffee-growing supplement, and fungicides to get rid of bug and disease infestations.

loans.use: to buy compost, fertilizers, and foliar insecticides to use on her coffee crops for protection and maintenance.

loans.name: Esi

texts.en:
Esi sells second-hand clothes in Wakrom (near Cape Coast). She was educated through the end of primary school.  She is married and has four children. Her husband is currently unemployed.  

Esi has been working in this enterprise for a year now. As the sole provider in the family, she is responsible for paying the family's utility bills and their children's school fees. 

Her loan will be used to increase her current stock levels. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to grow her second-hand clothing  enterprise and increase her capital base. 

In the long run she wants to expand her business into neighboring villages.

loans.use: to increase her current stock of used clothes.

loans.name: Gulbara

texts.ru: Гулбаре 64 года. Совместно с супругом воспитали пятерых детей. 4 девочки вышли замуж, проживают отдельно со своими семьями, сын не женат, проживает с родителями. В 2000 году, супруги начали бизнес в торговле продуктами питания, используя в качестве стартового капитала сумму в 25,000 сом (KGS). Сумев развить свой бизнес и обретя постоянных клиентов, Гулбара имеет среднемесячный доход в сумме 20,000 сом (KGS). Благодаря упорному труду в бизнесе, супруги смогли выдать достойно своих дочерей замуж, развить бизнес. В целях дальнейшего увеличения и расширения своего бизнеса, Гулбара обратилась в Микрофинансовый банк «Бай-Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 135,000 сом (KGS) на покупку продуктов питания оптом, чтобы в дальнейшем реализовывать в розницу. Доходы от кредита Гулбара планирует вложить в свадебное мероприятие для сына.
texts.en:
Gulbara is 64 years old.  Together with her husband, she has five children.  Their four daughters had been married off and live separately with their respective families.  Their son is not yet married and lives with them.  In 2000, using an initial investment of 25,000 KGS, the couple started their business of selling groceries.  Owing to Gulbara's ability to successfully expand her business and obtain regular clients, she is currently making 20,000 KGS per month.  

Thanks to their hard work, Gulbara and her husband were able to successfully marry off their daughters while advancing their business forward.  With the goal of further expanding her business, Gulbara applied for a loan of 135,000 KGS from the microfinance bank of Bai Tushum and Partners.  She is planning to use this loan to purchase groceries that she can sell in her shop.  Gulbara wants to use the profits from her business on her son's wedding celebration.

loans.use: to purchase groceries for resale in her shop

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase a truckload of plantains and bananas

loans.name: Mavjuda

texts.ru: Мавчуда родилась в 1964 года. Она замужем и на воспитании имеет 3 детей. Мавчуда порядочная женщина. Она уже 2 раз кредитуется в ИМОНе. Мавчуда своевременно погашает займ. Она имеет большой опыт по скотоводству. Мавчуда более 28 лет занимается скотоводством. Она знает все тонкости своего дела. Мавчуда начала свой бизнес с 1 одной коровой и данное время у нее в обороте 5 коров. Ее сын помогает ей по введению бизнеса. Ее муж занимается выращиванием сельхоз культур. Мавчуда хочет развевать свой бизнес и увеличить доход. От полученного дохода, ей бы хотелось улучшить состояние дома. Она запрашивает займ на сумму 5000 сомони для покупки скота для увеличения оборотного капитала. Она ждет вашу доброту.
texts.en:
Mavjuda was born in 1964.  She is married and is raising three children.  Mavjuda is a responsible woman and she pays all of her dues on time.  She has been a customer of IMON International twice before.  She has extensive experience in raising cattle.  For more than 28 years, Mavjuda has been working in this field and learning all of the nuances of this trade.  Mavjuda started her business with only a single cow and currently, she has five cows.  Her son is helping her run this business, while her husband cultivates crops.  

Mavjuda wishes to expand her business and to increase her income.  She very much wants to use the profits to improve her family's living situation.  She is asking for a loan of 5000 somoni to purchase cattle and to increase her working capital.  She is waiting for your kindness.

loans.use: To buy cattle for increasing her working capital.

loans.name: Vicente Saul

texts.es:
Vicente, tiene 29 años de edad, está casado tiene tres hijos de 12, 10 y 4 años de edad. Se dedica a la siembra de maíz y frijol que luego vende, su padre le enseño hacerlo desde que era un niño. El inicia sus labores desde muy tempranas horas del día para finalizar sujornada a tiempo y compartir más con su familia.
El capital que adquiera lo utilizara para la compra de semilla de maíz, frijol y también herbicida para llevar a cabo la siembra y tener una mejor cosecha.
Vicente anhela ampliar su casa, que el área donde siembra sea mucho más amplia y que sus hijos sean profesionales.
texts.en:
Vicente is 29 and married with three kids ages 12, 10, and 4. He plants corn and beans that he later sells. His father taught him how to do it when he was a child. He starts his work very early in the morning to finish up his work day on time and spend more time with his family. 

He will use the capital from the loan to purchase seeds for corn and beans, and also herbicide to carry out the planting and have a better harvest.
Vicente wishes he could make his house bigger, that the area where he plants were much bigger, and that his children can become professionals.

loans.use: Purchase seeds for corn and beans and herbicide for planting the seeds

loans.name: Adwowa

texts.en:
Adwowa is a small scale baker who bakes bread and sells it in Wakrom (near Cape Coast). She has had some form of formal education as she is a primary graduate. She is married and has 6 children. Her husband is a farmer. 

Adwowa has been working as a baker for close to 8 years. Her income is used to help her husband pay the utility bills and their children’s school fees.

She plans on using her loan to purchase an increased quantity of bread, thus allowing her to meet the rising customers demands. 

She hopes to use the profits from her enterprise to fulfill her dream of buying a bread stand, hence helping her sell from a fixed location in the future.

loans.use: to purchase more bread, thus allowing her to meet the rising customers demands.

loans.name: Maknuna

texts.ru: Макнуна трудолюбивая женщина. Ей 39 лет. Она замужем и на воспитании имеет 2 детей. Она всегда мечтала организовать свой бизнес и найти источник дохода. Макнуна с детства любила заниматься шитьем платьев. Любовь к своему делу и упорный труд дали ей возможность в совершенстве изучать все тонкости по шитью одежды. После того, как ее муж стал изменять ей, Макнуна была в обиде и поставила себе цель стать успешной в жизни. Она обучилась на курсе «Добейся Успеха» организованного Ассоциация Деловых Женщин и получила сертификат. Макнуна хочет организовать свой бизнес шитьем женской одежды. Она запрашивает займ на сумму 2500 долларов США для покупки швейной машинки и тканей. Она ждет вашу доброту и надеется на ваше милосердие.
texts.en:
Maknuna is a hard working woman.  She is 39 years old.  She is married and is raising two children.  She has always dreamed of starting her own business and finding a source of income.  From when she was a child, Maknuna enjoyed sewing dresses.  Love of this trade and a lot of hard work, gave her the ability to thoroughly learn all of the nuances of sewing clothes.  After a number of disappointments in her personal life, Maknuna decided to take control of her future.  She completed the course of "Woman Entrepreneur, Get Ahead", which is organized by the National Association of Business Women of Tajikistan.  

Now, Maknuna wants to start her own business of sewing women's clothing.  She is asking for a loan of 2,500 USD to purchase a sewing machine and some fabrics.  She is waiting for your kindness and is hoping for your generosity.

loans.use: To buy a sewing machine and fabrics so she can start a new business

loans.name: Adwowa

texts.en:
Although she received no prior formal education, Adwowa is an entrepreneur. She prepares and sells ‘Kenkey’ (a traditional Ghanaian dish made from corn dough and wrapped in banana leaves). She can be found selling ‘Kenkey’ in Wakrom (near Cape Coast). She has been involved in this enterprise for four  years. 

Adwowa is married and has six children. Her husband works as a farmer. The proceeds from her ‘Kenkey’ business normally go towards helping her husband cover the family’s general expenses and pay their children’s school fees. 

Adwowa will use this loan to purchase increased amounts of maize, thus aiding her to improve her overall sales. With her new profits from her expanded business, Adwowa plans to further diversify the types of products that she sells, hence adapting to changing customer preferences.

loans.use: to purchase increased amounts of maize, aiding her to improve her overall sales.

loans.name: Esi

texts.en:
Esi is married with five children. She received some schooling until the end of primary school. Esi currently sells cassavas, plantains and palm fruits in Wakrom (near Cape Coast), and she has been involved in this industry for about four years now. Her husband works in construction.  Esi's income goes towards helping her husband pay for the family's general expenses.  

Esi will use this loan to increase her existing stock of cassavas, plantains and palm fruits. With the new profits from her expanded enterprise, Esi  plans to develop her business further by venturing into new markets.

loans.use: to increase her existing stock of cassavas, plantains and palm fruits.

loans.name: Nida

texts.en:
Nida, age 44, is happy tending to her little store. She is single. The store is her means of earning a living to support her family. Fortunately, her store is located in a populous neighborhood, and so she makes promising daily sales.

Nida keeps on running the store well even though there is increased competition from other stores. Nida believes that with PMPC's support, and as one family, they will sustain and beat the competition.  

Nida has reached her first year being a member of Paglaum MPC. She has applied for a loan of PHP 40,000 for the store. Expanding her inventory will mean additional income. She has confidence that she can maintain the label of member in good standing. 

She is a hardworking woman, and wishes to sustain the store.

loans.use: to purchase additional canned goods, noodles, soft drinks and beverages.

loans.name: Gena

texts.en:
Gena joined Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative this year and she appreciates the programs, services, and continuous education of the co-op. She is a member in good standing and very active in attending the various programs and services that the Cooperative offers.

She is requesting a loan in the amount of PHP 7,000. This loan is intended to buy bananas, cassava, sugar, and oil.
Gena dreams of nothing more than to have a happy and healthy life and an adequate income out of her business.

loans.use: to buy bananas, cassava, sugar, and oil for her food stall.

loans.name: Auxilium

texts.en:
Auxilium is from Candanay Sur, Siquijor, Siquijor. She is 69 years old and is married with 2 children. 

In 2012, Auxilium applied for her membership with PMPC. Hearing about all the benefits, she did not hesitated to join. She maintains good standing and repays her obligations in a timely manner.

Recently, Auxilium asked for financial assistance of 50,000 PHP to purchase sacks of flour, sacks of sugar, yeast, and gallons of oil. Through this, she hopes to increase her income and expand her business. She has found assistance for her financial needs through Paglaum Multi Purpose Cooperative, and she is very thankful with all her heart.

loans.use: to purchase sacks of flour, sacks of sugar, yeast, and gallons of oil

loans.name: Marichel

texts.en:
Marichel is 34 years old, married, and a resident of Balamban, Mahayag Zamboanga del Sur, Philippines. She has 3 children. Starting with 3,000 PHP in capital, she opened a sari-sari (general store) and was able to expand it with the help of Paglaum Cooperative. She appreciated the financial assistance, was able to generate savings, and enjoys the benefits given by the co-op. She became a member in 2011 and has taken out eight loans. 

Now she is applying for 30,000 PHP to buy additional stocks for her sari-sari store, particularly basic commodities. In the future, she wants to own a mini-mart someday and will be fully satisfied if she sees her children finish their studies.

loans.use: to buy additional stocks for her sari-sari store

loans.name: Ekua

texts.en:
Although she received no prior formal education, Ekua is an entrepreneur. She prepares and sells ‘Kenkey’ (a traditional Ghanaian dish made from corn dough and wrapped in banana leaves). She can be found selling ‘Kenkey’ in Wakrom (near Cape Coast). 

Ekua has been involved in this enterprise for three  years. She is married and has children. Her husband works as a farmer. The proceeds from her ‘Kenkey’ business normally go towards helping her husband to cover the family’s general expenses and to pay their children’s school fees. 

Ekua will use this loan to purchase increased amounts of maize, thus aiding her to improve her overall sales. With the new profits from her expanded business, Ekua plans to further diversify the type of products that she sells, hence adapting to changing customer preferences.

loans.use: purchase increased amounts of maize, aiding her to improve her overall sales.

loans.name: Adwowa

texts.en:
Even though Adwowa grew up in poverty without an education, this did not stop her from fulfilling her dream of achieving a better life for herself and her family. Currently, Adwowa is an entrepreneur. She prepares and sells cooked rice and ‘Wakye’ (a traditional Ghanaian dish made primarily from beans, rice, and colored leaves) for a living. She primarily sells her ‘Wakye’ in Wakrom (near Cape Coast). 

Adwowa's business enterprise has grown substantially since she began ten years ago. She uses the income from her business to help her husband raise their two children. Adwowa has identified that there is a growing demand among consumers’ for her ‘Wakye’. Nevertheless, she has been unable to meet their needs due to a limited inventory capacity. Thus, she aims to use this loan to purchase a greater quantity of rice and beans, therefore helping her to prepare more of her tasty ‘Wakye’. 

With her new profits from her expanded business, Adwowa wants to buck the trend by ensuring that all of her children will be given the opportunity to further distance their family from poverty.

loans.use: to purchase a greater quantity of rice and beans, helping her to prepare more of her tasty ‘Wakye’.

loans.name: Ama

texts.en:
Ama is divorced and has four children. Even though she did not receive any formal education, Ama is a successful businesswoman. She prepares and sells ‘Banku’ for a living (a traditional Ghanaian dish made using fermented corn/cassava dough, which is mixed proportionally and cooked in hot water into a smooth, whitish, consistent paste). She normally sells her ‘Banku’ in Wakrom (near Cape Coast). 

Ama has been actively involved in this business for about ten years. As the sole breadwinner in her family, Ama uses her income to provide for the entire family. Ama will use this loan to purchase increased amounts of maize and cassava, thus aiding her to improve her overall sales. 

With her new profits from her expanded business, Ama plans to further diversify the type of products that she sells, hence adapting to changing customer preferences.

loans.use: to purchase increased amounts of maize and cassava, aiding her to improve her overall sales.

loans.name: Marivic

texts.en:
Marivic, age 50, is happy tending her little store. She is married with three kids, and her husband is a butcher. The store is her means of earning a living to support her family. Fortunately, her store is located in a populous neighborhood, and so she makes promising daily sales. Marivic keeps on running the store well even though there is increased competition from other stores. Marivic believes that with PMPC's support, as one family they will sustain and beat the competition.  

Marivic has reached her 5th year being a member of Paglaum MPC. She has applied for a loan of PHP 50,000 for the store. Expanding her inventory will mean additional income. She has confidence that she can maintain the label of member in good standing. She is a hardworking mother and wishes to sustain the store and from that afford a good education for her children.

loans.use: to buy products to sell, such as noodles, rice, soft drinks, etc.

location.town: Sindangan -  Motibot, Sindangan, Zamboanga del Nor

loans.name: Norma

texts.en:
Norma joined Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative in the year 2010, and she appreciates the programs, services, and continuous education of the co-op. She is a member in good standing and very active in attending the various programs and services that the Cooperative offers. She is requesting a loan in the amount of PHP 15,000. This loan is intended to buy additional farm inputs.

Norma dreams of nothing more than to have a happy, healthy life and an adequate income out of her business.

loans.use: To buy addtional farm inputs.

loans.name: Cristina

texts.en:
Cristina is 47 years old who is very responsible with her household obligations since she has always been known to provide the best for her family. She currently lives with her husband and two children. She is a farmer who plants corn, beans, vegetables and rice.

Cristina wants to increase her sales. Consequently, she has requested a loan that will enable her to purchase seeds, compost, and fertilizer among other items so she can continue to put bread on the table in her home.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers and seedlings.

location.town: Sindangan - Dicoyong, Sindangan, Zamboanga del Nor

loans.name: Nazira

texts.ru: Назира родилась в 1970 года. Она с самых ранних лет мечтала открыть свой бизнес. После окончания средней школы она вышла замуж. В родительском доме она научилась вязать зимние одежды. Данное время семья Назиры нуждается в деньгах, так как единственный доход семьи это денежный перевод от мужа, который он отправляет им с России, не хватает на жизнь. Она хочет организовать свой бизнес вязанием одежды и продажей. Она хочет приносить дополнительный доход семье и таким образом улучшить условию проживания. Она запрашивает займ на сумму 1000 сомони для покупки шерстяных ниток. Она ждет вашу доброту.
texts.en:
Nazira was born in 1970.  From the time when she was little, she dreamed of opening her own business.  Nazira married right after finishing high school.  While living in her parent's house, she learned how to knit winter clothing.  Currently, Nazira's family does not have enough money to live on.  The sole financial income for her family comes from her husband, who working abroad, in Russia.  

Nazira wants to start her own business of making and selling of knitted clothing.  She wishes to bring additional income into the family and to improve their living situation.  She is asking for a loan of 1000 somoni to purchase wool yarn.  She is waiting for your kindness.

loans.use: To purchase wool yarn so she can start her own business.

loans.name: Mahsuda

texts.ru: Махсуде 50 лет. Она замужем и на воспитании имеет 4 детей. Махсуда имеет высшее педагогическое образование. Она более 26 лет работает в средней школе учительницей. Ее муж по специальности тоже педагог, но он уже много лет является трудовым мигрантом в Российской Федерации. Она хочет, чтобы все ее дети получили высшее образование. Ее дети учатся в университете. Она должна оплатить за учебный договор своего сына в университете, но не имеет денег. Она запрашивает займ на сумму 5000 сомони для оплаты учебного договора. Она ждет вашу доброту и надеется на ваше милосердие.
texts.en: Mahsuda is 50 years old.  She is married and is raising four children.  Mahsuda has a degree in teaching.  For over 26 years, she has been employed as a teacher at a high school.  He husband is also a teacher, but for many years now, he has been working abroad in the Russian Federation.  She wants for her children to obtain higher education.  Her children are currently studying at the university.  Mahsuda needs to pay for their tuition costs, but she does not have the money to do so.  She is asking for a loan of 5000 somoni to pay for her children's education costs.  She is waiting for your kindness and is hoping for your generosity.

loans.use: To pay for her children's university education

loans.name: Nelia

texts.en:
Nelia earns a living by means of transportation services. She is 44 years old and married with two children. She lives in Dicoyong, Sindangan, Zamboanga Del Norte. Her services is self-sustainable and has become profitable, with a net profit of about PHP 20,000 per month.  

Nelia is seeking a PHP 14,900 loan. She would like to use the loan for the repair and maintenance of her vehicle. This is a micro-finance loan, and would be repaid in a few months. 

In her 10 (ten) previous loans, she never had a delinquency. Nelia is very diligent and loves accuracy, which only adds to the effective management of her venture.

loans.use: to pay for the repair and maintenance of her vehicle.

loans.name: Eltrudes

texts.en:
Eltrudes, age 50, is from Balamban, Mahayag Zamboanga del Sur, Philippines. She is married with 9 children. PMPC supported her by providing the capital to start her hog raising business. She sold one pig at a time, helping the family survive. She gives her best efforts to produce good pigs, in order to sell them continuously. 

Eltrudes is now trying to expand her pig business. She has applied for a loan of PHP 5,000 to buy additional feeds for her growing business. She is thankful to Paglaum MPC for financing her capital needs. 

In addition, she wanted her business to be well known, and to build a good business management for her loyal customers. She wishes to send all her children to school so they may have stable careers.

loans.use: to buy feeds for hog raising.

loans.name: Tessie

texts.en:
Tessie is 60 years old, married, and lives at Balamban, Mahayag Zamboanga del Sur, Philippines. In order to earn a living, she takes in and raises pigs from their neighborhood. The piglets owners share the profit upon sale, to be divided 60/40 or 70/30, depending in their agreement. With a desire to earn more, she decided to raise pigs on her own as well.
 
Through Pauglam Multi Purpose Cooperative, she obtained the capital to purchase her original piglets & feed. Now, she requests a loan of 9,000 PHP to buy additional piglets and feeds. 

She really hopes and prays that her business would grow and benefit her family, in addition to the income from her husband. Someday, she wants to build a concrete pig cage to easily keep more sanitary conditions.

loans.use: to buy additional piglets and feeds for her piggery business.

loans.name: Derek

texts.en:
Derek used to be a music blogger up until April of 2010, when he started DBA Technologies & Design, a business that builds apps for the Web, offers media management services, website development, and media/IT consultancy. His business is home-based and has three employees: a sales director, a PT assistant and an accountant--who also happens to be his mother. 

"I am very content with my life as it is, and the blessings I have been provided with my business success and family. I would like to see my business grow more, up to about ten employees, and increase our national presence in media development for the United States. I see my company as one of the nation’s top ten app-development media firms within five years," he says. 

Derek is very passionate about technology and has an undying faith in himself and his employees. Obtaining a loan would be transformative and would allow him to continue down the road to success.

loans.use: to purchase an iMac workstation.

loans.name: Rosela

texts.en:
Rosela earns a living by means of tailoring services. She is 52 years old, separated, and lives in Lawis, Sindangan, Zamboanga del Norte. She is now well known for the nice quality of services she offers. Her services are self-sustainable and has become profitable, with a net profit of about PHP 8,000 per month.  

Rosela is seeking a PHP 5,000 loan. She would like to use the loan to purchase products for food vending as her other source of income. This is a micro-finance loan, and would be repaid in a few months. This was her first loan. Rosela is very diligent and loves accuracy, which only adds to the effective management of her venture.

loans.use: to buy goods and products for her food vending business.

loans.name: Wilma

texts.en:
Wilma, age 45, is happy tending to her little store. She is married with four kids, and her husband is a driver. The store is her means of earning a living in support of her family. Fortunately, her store is located in a populous neighborhood and so she makes promising daily sales. 

Wilma keeps on running the store well even though there is an increased competition from other stores. Wilma believes that with PMPC's support, and as one family, they will sustain and beat the competition.  

Wilma has reached her fifth year being a member of Paglaum MPC. She has applied for a loan of PHP 3,000 for the store. Expanding her inventory will mean additional income. She has confidence that she can maintain the label of member in good standing. 

She is a hardworking mother and wishes to sustain the store and from it provide good education she could afford for her children.

loans.use: to buy commodities, such as canned goods, noodles, etc.

loans.name: Muhabbat

texts.ru: Мухаббат из района Спитамен. Ей 53 года. Она живет с мужем, тремя дочерьми и сыном. Ее муж работает на заводе по обрабатыванию хлопка, прессовщиком. Мухаббат печет лепешки в пекарне и продает их на центральном рынке. Одновременно она арендует 2 га участка земли, на котором выращивает рис. Сейчас Мухаббат хочет у себя дома заниматься скотоводством. У нее нет опыта работы в этой сфере деятельности. Но ей помогут соседи. Почти двух третей населения Спитаменского района занимаются животноводством. Мухаббат начинает свой бизнес с собственным капиталом в виде коровника и корма для скота. На сумму от кредита она хочет закупить 4 голов коров и телят.
texts.en:
Muhabbat is from the Spitamen region of Tajikistan.  She is 53 years old, and lives together with her husband, 3 daughters, and her son.  Her husband works in a cotton-processing factory as a press operator, whereas Muhabbat bakes flatbread in a bakery and sells it at a local market.  She is currently a tenant on a 2-hectare plot of land where she grows rice.  

Lately, Muhabbat has been thinking it would be a good idea to start raising livestock at home.  She has no previous experience doing so, but her neighbors do, and are willing to help her if need be; nearly two-thirds of the population in Spitamen raise livestock.  Muhabbat will be using her own money to build a cow shed and buy cattle feed for her new business, and hopes to use a loan to buy cattle (4 cows and 4 calves).

loans.use: buy 4 cows and calves each to set up a new business (fattening cattle and selling them).

loans.name: Lourgyn

texts.en:
Lourgyn, 30 years old, is very responsible with her household obligations since she has always been known to provide the best for her family. She currently lives with her husband and two children. She is a farmer who plants rice and corn.

Lourgyn wants to increase sales. Consequently, she has requested a loan that will enable her to purchase seeds, compost, and fertilizer, among other items, so that she can continue to put bread on the table in her home.

loans.use: To buy additional farm material, including seeds, compost, and fertilizer.

loans.name: Elsa

texts.en:
Elsa  is 53 years old, married, and a resident of Calube, Aloran. She earns a living through snack vending. 

She is a member of PMPC and enjoys the privileges being a member of the Cooperative. Now, she is applying for a loan of  7,000 PHP (Philippine pesos) to purchase additional raw ingredients for snack vending.

Elsa deeply wishes to maintain a member in good standing with PMPC.

loans.use: to purchase additional raw ingredients for snack vending

loans.name: Walter

texts.en:
At the age of 4, Walter’s family moved from Nicaragua to the United States in hopes for a better life. From an early age, Walter was mentored by his grandparents in the art of leadership and entrepreneurship. Taking their advice to heart, Walter started his own business three years ago. "Nothing compares to being your own boss," he says. 

Walter owns Vision Marketing Plus Corp. His home-based business provides marketing services for companies and products that provide energy efficiency for both residential and commercial properties. His company handles the sales, obtaining of new clientele, surveying, and quoting for clients--all in an effort to make buildings more energy efficient in order to save clients money in the long run. 

Family is very important to Walter, and when he needed a new employee, he hired his mother. Walter dreams of continuing to expand his business and making an impact in the energy efficiency sector.

loans.use: to purchase a new vehicle that is needed for site visits and day-to-day operations.

loans.name: Alicia

texts.en:
Alicia is 62 years old, married, and a resident of Delusom, Leon B. Postigo, Zamboanga Del Norte, Philippines. Her husband is a farmer. They have seven children, of whom six are already married and one is in school. Starting with 5,000 PHP in capital, she opened a sari-sari (general store) and was able to expand it with the help of Paglaum Cooperative. As a result of the financial assistance, she was able to generate savings and enjoys the benefits  given by the co-op. She became a member in July 2008 and has taken out twelve loans. 

Now she is applying for 10,000 PHP to buy additional stocks for her sari-sari store, particularly basic commodities. In the future, she wants to own a mini-mart and will be fully satisfied if she sees her children finish their studies.

loans.use: to buy products to display

loans.name: Daisy

texts.en: Mrs. Daisy is married and has two children of school age. She is currently a barangay councilor (elected official)  of the barangay where she lives. Because her honorarium does not cover their daily needs, she went into business. Her business is buying and selling agricultural products, such as sweet potatoes, bananas of various species, and many others. She has been in this business for one year and has found that it has a good return on investment. She has been a member of Paglaum Multipurpose Cooperative for a year, and she has availed herself of loans before. This loan is intended to buy additional stock for sale, because the store produces a good income for her family and can help in uplifting their financial status.

loans.use: to buy additonal stocks of root crops to sell.

loans.name: Rosario

texts.en:
Rosario is a 42-year-old member of Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative from Balamban, Mahayag Zamboanga del Sur, industriously caring for her farming activities.  She is married and has four children.  She personally takes charge of their business, and the children work for her as support. 

The business is doing well. Rosario has humbly taught her children the techniques of how to enjoy business and at the same time make earnings from it. The ups and downs of the business are nothing but a normal situation for her. Sometimes they have business losses, sometimes a good return. She is a savvy business woman. 

Now Rosario sees a good opportunity to expand their business. She is requesting PHP 12,000 from Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative for capital to buy additional inputs for farming. She deeply wishes for a good education for her kids and for them to have businesses of their own.

loans.use: To purchase additional inputs for farming.

loans.name: Amparo

texts.en: Amparo is 73 years old, married, and has seven children. She works very hard to provide for them. Amparo runs a general store in the Philippines and applied for a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy more groceries to sell.  Amparo has been in this business for 30 years and sells a variety of items, such as rice, soft drinks, bread and other groceries. In the future, Amparo would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more groceries to sell in her store.

loans.name: Carmelie

texts.en: Carmelie is 61 years old, married, and has five children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur.  She has a tailoring business in the Philippines. Carmelie requested a PHP 16,000 loan through NWTF in order to buy material needed for her business.  Carmelie has been in this business for 15 years. In the future, Carmelie would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy material needed for her business.

loans.name: Elisa

texts.en: Elisa is 49 years old, married, and has four children.  Elisa works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and applied for a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF in order to buy more goods, such as bread, soft drinks, spices and other groceries.  Elisa has borrowed and repaid four loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for three years, and she also earns an income from raising pigs.  Elisa aspires to save enough money to expand her business and repair her family home.

loans.use: to buy more items to sell in her store, such as bread, soft drinks, spices and other groceries.

loans.name: Teresita

texts.en: Teresita  is a member of Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative, and she appreciates the programs, services and continuous education of the co-op. She is a member in good standing and very active in attending the various programs and services that it offers. She is applying for a loan in the amount of PHP 5,000. This loan is intended to pay the rent on space for the retail business. Teresita  dreams of nothing more than to have a happy, healthy life and an adequate income from her business.

loans.use: to pay the rent on retail space.

loans.name: Delia

texts.en:
Delia lives in Balamban, Mahayag Zamboanga del Sur, Philippines.  She is 45 years old, married and has seven kids. In 2011, she applied for membership to Paglaum MPC. Hearing of all the benefits of being a member, she didn't hesitate to become one.  She maintains herself as a credible member in good standing, and she always pays her loans in a timely manner. 

Recently, she asked for a loan of PHP 23,000 for additional capital for her farming activity.  She plants rice and corn. Through this project, she believes she will be able to raise more income and help the expansion of the business.  Delia has found comfort in their financial needs through Paglaum MPC, for which she is very thankful with all her heart.

loans.use: To buy farm inputs and farming tools.

loans.name: Bengy

texts.en:
Bengy is from Balamban, Mahayag Zamboanga del Sur. She is 32 years old and is married with one kid. 

In 2010, Bengy applied her membership with PMPC.  Hearing of all the benefits, she did not hesitated to become one. She maintains her status as a member in good standing and repays her loans in a timely manner.

Recently, Bengy is asking for financial assistance in the amount of  PHP 15,000 to purchase farming tools and farm inputs. Through this, she hopes to increase her income and help the expansion of her business. She has found assistance for her financial needs through Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative, and she is thankful with all her heart.

loans.use: To purchase farming tools and farm inputs.

loans.name: Floreta

texts.en:
Floreta is 58 years old, married, a resident of Balamban, Mahayag Zamboanga del Sur. She earns a living through farming.

She has been a member of PMPC for four years and enjoys the privileges being a member of the Cooperative. Now, she is applying for a loan of PHP 15,000 to purchase farm inputs and farming tools.

Floreta deeply wishes to maintain her status as a member in good standing with PMPC.

loans.use: To buy farm inputs and farming tools

loans.name: Filomena

texts.en:
Filomena is widowed, with three children. She is 63 years old and lives in Colambutan Bajo, in the Philippines.

Filomena sells a variety of products to earn a living, and she has had this business for 10 years. Each month, she earns PHP 2,000 doing this type of work. 

She has requested a loan of PHP 8,000 to purchase additional products, such as vinegar, oil, sauces, salt, sugar, sweets, sardines, noodles, soaps, etc.

Filomena has been a member of PMPC for seven years.  In the future, she hopes to improve and expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional products, such as vinegar, oil, sauces, salts, sugar, sweets, sardines, noodles, soaps, etc.

loans.name: Virgilia

texts.en:
Virgilia is married with four children. She is 66 years old and lives in Unidos, Plaridel, Misamis Occidental.

Virgilia sells banana to earn a living and has had this business for 10 years. Each month, she earns PHP 8,500 doing this type of work. She has requested a loan for 12,000 to purchase additional bananas.

Virgilia has been a member of PMPC for eight years.  In the future, Virgilia hopes to be successful in her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional bananas.

loans.name: Alba

texts.en:
Alba is widowed and has two children. She is 49 years old and lives in Sinuza, Tudela, in the Philippines.

Alba sells a variety of products to earn a living and has had her business for 20 years. Each month, she earns 1,600 PHP doing this type of work. She has requested a loan of 14,000 PHP to purchase additional products such as breads, biscuits, chocolates, candies, canned goods, noodles, junk foods, beverages, detergents, soaps, and other products.

Alba has been a member of PMPC for 5 years. In the future, Alba hopes to save for future emergencies and support her relatives financially.

loans.use: to purchase additional products such as breads, chocolates, canned goods, noodles, beverages, soaps, etc.

loans.name: Hoeun

texts.en:
Hoeun is 36 years old. She is married and resides with one child in Kampong Chhnang Province, Cambodia. She has been selling sugar for more than ten years, earning approximately $5 per day. Her husband is a construction worker who makes an income of $5 daily. 

Hoeun asks for a loan of $350 to pay for her son’s study fees. In addition, a part of this money is used to buy school stationery. This money will help her son learn Korean and work in Korea. In the future, she would like to purchase farmland for growing rice and to build a new house.

loans.use: to pay for her son's study fees

loans.name: Louzelin

texts.en:
Louzelin is single with one child. She is 34 years old and lives in Mialen, Clarin, Philippines.

Louzelin sells rice crops to earn a living and has had this business for 10 years. Each month, she earns PHP 1,900 doing this type of work. She has requested a loan of 5,000 PHP to purchase additional fertilizers and other agricultural chemicals such as insecticides, pesticides, acaricides, and herbicides.

Louzelin has been a member of PMPC for two years.  In the future, Louzelin hopes to improve and expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional fertilizers and other agricultural chemicals such as insecticides, pesticides, acaricides and herbicides.

loans.name: Luzma

texts.en:
Luzma is married with five children. Luzma  is 45 years old and lives in Señor, Sinacaban, Philippines.

Luzma sells snacks and other goods to earn a living and has had this business for 20 years. Each month, she earns PHP 2,000 doing this type of work. She has requested a loan of PHP 10,500 to buy additional goods such as biscuits, crackers, chocolates, candies, canned goods, noodles and toothpaste.

Luzma has been a member of PMPC for seven years. In the future, Luzma hopes to improve and expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional goods such as biscuits, crackers, chocolates, candies, canned goods, noodles and toothpaste.

loans.name: Melanie Ann

texts.en:
Melanie Ann, age 24, is happy tending her little store.  She is single with one child who is in school. The store is her means of earning a living in support to her family.  Fortunately, her store is located in a populous neighborhood and so she makes promising daily sales.  Melanie Ann keeps running the store well even though there is increased competition from other stores.   Melanie Ann believes that with PMPC's support, as a family they will beat the competition.  

Melanie Ann has been a new member of Paglaum MPC.  She has applied for a loan of PHP 30,000 for the store. Expanding her inventory will mean additional income. She has confidence that she can maintain the label of member in good standing. She is a hardworking mother and wishes to sustain the store and from there a good education she could afford for her child.

loans.use: To purchase additional canned goods, noodles, shampoos, toothpaste and soft drinks.

loans.name: Milagros

texts.en:
Milagros is single with no children. She is 51 years old and lives in Tinacla-an,Clarin, Philippines.

Milagros is a farmer and raises pigs to earn a living. She has been doing this for 30 years. She has requested a loan to purchase additional feed and agrivet supplies such as medicines and vaccines,etc.

Milagros has been a member of PMPC for 6 years. In the future, she hopes to improve and expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional feed and agrivet supplies such as medicines and vaccines,etc.

loans.name: Charina Rosario

texts.en:
This is Charina Rosario, 45, a resident of Silang, Cavite, Philippines. She is married to Salvador, a messenger, and they have children who are all in school. She and her husband are managing their household while operating the business. They are both working hard to provide for their everyday needs.

Charina Rosario is an egg retailer. What she basically does is buy egg from wholesalers and then sells them with a little profit. Customers are attracted to buy due to the low selling prices she offered. She also has a variety store for additional income. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of 2,000 Philippine Pesos (PHP) in sales every day. 

Charina Rosario is requesting a loan amounting to PHP 25,000 that she will use to purchase additional stocks of eggs. She will also use the loan in buying grocery items and toiletries for her variety store.

Charina Rosario hopes to be successful in life and business and dreams that her children will finish their studies. She meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies. 

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for more stock of eggs needed in her business.

loans.name: Roneta

texts.en:
Roneta is 54 years old and lives in Señor, Sinacaban, Philippines. She is married with three children. 

To earn a living, Roneta has a business selling snacks in the community. She earns about PHP 1,999 each month doing this type of work. Roneta has  requested a loan to purchase additional ingredients such as flour, sugar, oil, butter, baking powder, food coloring and other items.

Roneta has been a member of PMPC for eight years. In the future, Roneta would like to improve and expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional ingredients such as flour, sugar, oil, butter, baking powder, food coloring and other items.

loans.name: Sandra Elizabeth

texts.es:
Sandra, es una joven de 24 años vive con su esposo y su hijo de 4 años en casa propia. Hace un año tuvo la iniciativa de instalar una tienda en su residencia, la cual ella misma atiende todos los días.  
Ella solicita un préstamo para poder surtir más su tienda y así satisfacer la demanda de sus clientes que cada día buscan productos con los que ella no cuenta. Con el capital Sandra comprara jabón, lejía, aceite y azúcar.
Su aspiración es mejorar la atención a los clientes, generar mayores ingresos  y obtener mejores beneficios para su familia.
texts.en:
Sandra is a 24-year-old young woman who lives with her husband and her 4-year-old son in a house of their own. A year ago, she took the initiative and started a store in her home where she works every day.

She is asking for a loan so that she will be able to stock up her store to a greater capacity. This will allow her to satisfy the demands of her customers who daily look for products which she doesn't have. With the money, Sandra will purchase soap, bleach, cooking oil, and sugar. 

She has aspirations to improve customer service, generate greater income, and get better returns for her family.

loans.use: to buy soap, bleach, cooking oil, and sugar.

loans.name: Aida

texts.en:
Aida earns a living offering sewing services.  She is 62 years old, separated and lives in Cangbagsa, Larena, Siquijor. She is now well known for the nice quality of services she offers.  She has already made some new clothing and has been able to save money from selling it.  Her service is self-sustainable and has become profitable, with a net profit of about PHP 12,000.00 per month.

Aida is seeking a PHP  20,000.00 loan. She would like to use the loan to purchase special items such as a sewing machine, beads and different colors of cloth. This is a regular loan, and would be repaid in few  months.  In her previous loans she has never had a delinquency.  Aida is very diligent and loves accuracy which only adds to effective management of her venture.

loans.use: To purchase a sewing machine, cloth and sewing supplies

loans.name: Norma

texts.en:
Norma is 59 years old, married and lives in Pangi, Siquijor, Philippines. In order to earn a living she takes in and raises pigs from their neighborhood.  The piglets' owners share in profit upon sale, to be divided 60/40 or 70/30 depending in their agreement.  With a desire to earn more, she decided to raise pigs on her own as well.

Through Paglaum MPC she obtained the capital to purchase her original piglets & feed. Now, she requests a loan of PHP 40,000.00 to buy additional feed. She really hopes & prays that her business will grow and benefit her family, in addition to the income of her husband. Someday, she wants to build a concrete pig cage to easily keep more sanitary conditions.

loans.use: To purchase additional piglets and feed

loans.name: Teofila

texts.en:
Teofila is 51 years old and lives in Dela Paz, Clarin, Philippines. She is married with six children. 

Teofila works in the fish industry and catches fish for a living. She has been doing this for 20 years. She has requested a loan to acquire additional fishing materials and accessories, namely fishing tackle, a fishing rod, fishing net, fishing gear and other tools.

Teofila has been a member of PMPC for eight years. In the future, Teofila hopes to financially support her immediate family members.

loans.use: to acquire additional fishing materials and accessories, namely fishing tackle, a fishing rod, fishing net, fishing gear and other tools.

loans.name: Leonila

texts.en:
Leonila is widowed with five children. Leonila is 59 years old and lives in Dela Paz, Clarin, Philippines.

Leonila sells nipa (palm leaf) huts to earn a living and has had this business for 20 years. Each month, she earns PHP 5,000 doing this type of work. She has requested a loan for PHP 7,000 to pay for the acquisition of additional local materials used for nipa hut-making such as bamboo, nipa, coconut, different woods and other materials.

Leonila has been a member of PMPC for six years. In the future, Leonila hopes to financially support her immediate family members.

loans.use: to pay for the acquisition of additional local materials used for nipa hut-making such as bamboo, nipa, coconut, and wood.

loans.name: Melesio

texts.es:
Melesio tiene 22 años vive en la ciudad de Aguaytia y es padre de un pequeño de 1 año de edad, al que quiere mucho y por el cual lucha cada día para salir adelante; tal es así que Melesio trabaja para una institución de su ciudad, en la cual labora alrededor de 9 horas al día; él cree que le va bien en su trabajo porque es responsable.

Melesio está muy agradecido con los prestamistas kiva ya que gracias a la ayuda que le han brindado el podrá comprar un terreno en el cual más adelante podrá construir su vivienda y poder darle a su familia una vida mejor.
texts.en:
Melesio is 22 years old and lives in the city of Aguaytia. He is the father to a one-year-old, and he fights every day to help his son to get ahead. As such, Melesio works for a company in the city for about nine hours every day. He thinks his work is going very well because he is responsible.

Melesio is very grateful to Kiva lenders, since he will be able to buy a plot of land thanks to the help they've offered him. In the future, he will build a home on this land and be able to give his family a better life.

loans.use: to buy a plot of land.

loans.name: Nora Alejandra

texts.es: Nora es una joven de la edad de 21 años, quien desea progresar en la vida, hoy en día estudia la carrera de comunicación y relaciones públicas, sus padres le ayudan a pagar la mensualidad de la universidad, ya que actualmente ella no trabaja, pero está ejerciendo sus prácticas de profesión en una radio local en Managua, adquiriendo experiencia. Nora solicita el apoyo de crédito para pagar el curso de titulación de su carrera y postgrado en Gerencia de Marketing y Ventas, el cual está por culminar, y con titulo en mano le será más fácil optar por un empleo.
texts.en:
Nora is a young woman aged 21 who wishes to make progress in life. Currently, she is studying Communication and Public Relations. Her parents help her to pay the monthly university fees, since she isn't working for the time being. She is doing an internship at a local radio in Managua, acquiring experience. 

Nora is applying for a loan in order to pay for her degree course validation as well as for her Master of Business Management and Marketing, which she is about to complete. With a validated degree it will be easier for her to find a job.

loans.use: to pay for her degree course validation and her post-graduate studies

loans.name: Maria Auxiliadora

texts.es: María auxiliadora, es una humilde señora que habita en un barrio marginal de Managua, tiene  a cargo dos hijos de las edades de 8 y 10 años que estudian en un colegio público, su mayor deseo es que ellos sean unos profesionales en la vida. Ella junto a su esposo se dedican a la venta de frutas y verduras en su casa de habitación y de manera ambulante, este es su único medio de ingresos para ambos, con lo que mantienen las necesidades de sus hijos. Solicita este crédito para invertir en su pequeño negocio comprando naranjas, cebollas, tomates, piña, plátanos, limones, con esta inversión espera mejorar sus ingresos para continuar cubriendo los gastos de su hogar y de la familia.
texts.en:
María Auxiliadora is a humble lady who lives in the marginal neighborhood of Managua. She has 2 children who she cares for who are 8 and 10 years old. They go to public school. Her greatest desire is that they might be professionals someday. 

She works together with her husband selling fruits and vegetables out of their house and also as street vendors. This is their only way of income to care for the needs of their children. 

She requests this loan to invest in their little business by buying oranges, onions, tomatoes, pineapples, plantains, and lemons. With this investment, she expects to improve her income so that she can continue covering the expenses of their home and family.

loans.use: to buy oranges, onions, tomatoes, pineapple, plantains, lemons.

loans.name: Mavluda

texts.ru: Мавлюда более 25 лет занимается шитьем женской одежды. 12 лет назад внезапно умер ее муж. Она осталась с 5 детьми. Она ее дочь инвалид. Долгие годы она была в депрессии после смерти мужа и не приходила в себя. Постепенно дети выросли, и стали ей помогать по домохозяйству. Они находятся в России. Мавлюда в ИМОНе кредитуется 3 раз и имеет хорошую кредитную историю. Она честная и порядочная женщина. Мавлюда хочет женить сына, но не имеет денег. Она запрашивает займ на сумму 7500 сомони для проведения свадебного торжества своего сына. Она ждет вашу доброту и надеется на ваше милосердие.
texts.en:
Mavluda has worked with sewing women's clothing for more than 25 years. 12 years ago her husband suddenly died. She was left with five children. One of her daughters is disabled. After her husband's death she was depressed for some long years, and was not herself. 

Gradually her children grew up and started helping her with money the household. They are located in Russia. Mavluda takes a loan from IMON for the third time and has a good credit history. She is an honest and decent woman. 

Mavluda would like to marry her son away, but does not have the money. She requests a loan in the amount of 7,500 somoni for holding a wedding party for her son. She awaits your kindness and hopes for your charity.

loans.use: to arrange a wedding party for her son

loans.name: Candelaria

texts.en:
Candelaria is 53 years of age and a resident of Balamban, Mahayag Zamboanga del Sur, Philippines. She is married with four kids. They have farming business from which to earn a living. With their business they meet many challenges, but they realized that it is good to face the challenges rather than get discouraged. 

Candelaria and her husband work hard in selling their harvest to the market. Sometimes there are wholesale buyers from other towns and cities who come to buy their harvest. With their savings, they welcome the idea of expanding their business. They have requested from Paglaum MPC a PHP 15,000 loan. They feel assured of Paglaum MPC’s help, should there be a need for working capital in the future.

loans.use: To buy farm inputs and farming tools.

loans.name: Norma

texts.en:
Norma is 65 years old, married and has four children. She lives in Calaran, Calamba, Misamis Occidental. She has been engaged in food production, such as peanut butter and yema candy, for almost eight years and earns a monthly income of 2,500 PHP. 

She requested a new loan as additional capital for her business, so she can sell more to her customers. She wishes to have more savings someday.

loans.use: to buy ingredients to make peanut butter.

loans.name: Carlos Giovanni

texts.es:
Carlos es un joven de 21 años de edad, el cual trabaja como operario de construcción ya que con este humilde empleo puede solventar sus gastos de manutención y con ello salir adelante, Carlos trabaja alrededor de 10 horas al día y cree que le va bien en su trabajo porque es muy cuidadoso y responsable.

Carlos está muy agradecido con los prestamistas kiva ya que gracias a la ayuda que le han brindado podrá comprar  mercadería como ropa  con lo cual iniciara su pequeño negocio y poder tener un ingreso extra y poder seguir luchando para hacer realidad su gran sueño:” Tener su casa propia”.
texts.en:
Carlos is a young man aged 21 who works as a construction worker. This humble job allows him to pay for his expenses and to forge ahead. Carlos works around 10 hours a day and he believes that it is going well because he is very careful and responsible. 

Carlos is very grateful to the Kiva lenders, because with their help he will be able to buy merchandise such as clothes, which he will use to open a little business. That way, he will get an additional income and continue struggling to make his greatest dream come true: "To have his own house".

loans.use: to buy merchandise (clothes)

loans.name: Ainura

texts.ru: Айнуре 37 лет, замужем, вместе с супругом воспитывают 3 детей. У Айнуры - высшее образование, работает в местной школе преподавателем. В качестве дополнительного дохода для своей семьи Айнура занимается животноводством, стартовав 10 лет назад, с покупки скота на 10,000 сом KGS. Благодаря упорному труду Айнуры, в ее хозяйстве на сегодняшний день имеется: 2 дойные коровы, 1 кобыла, 10 овец, а также имеет земельный надел мерою 1,18 ГА, на котором ежегодно выращивает перец, картошку, клевер. Ежемесячный доход составляет 6,000 сом (KGS). В целях дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, Айнура обратилась в Микрофинансовый банк «Бай –Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 30,000 сом (KGS) на покупку нетели для увеличения поголовья скота. Доходы от кредита Айнура планирует вложить в дальнейшее приумножение количества домашней скотины, и планирует накопить средства на дальнейшее обучение детей.
texts.en:
Ainura is 37 years old, married and raising three children together with her husband. Ainura has higher education, and works as a teacher at the local school. As an additional income for her family, Ainura works with livestock breeding, after having started 10 years ago with the purchase of livestock for 10,000 som (KGS). Thanks to Ainura's persistent work, her farm currently has two dairy cows, a mare, 10 sheep and also a plot of land of 1.18 hectares. Here she grows peppers, potatoes and clover every year. The monthly income is 6,000 som (KGS). 

With an aim to further develop her business, Ainura turned to the microfinance bank "Bai Tushum & Partners" for a loan in the amount of 30,000 som (KGS) for the purchase of heifers for increasing the number of cattle. Ainura plans to invest the income from the loan in further increasing the number of household animals. She also plans to save money for the future education of her children.

loans.use: to buy heifers

loans.name: Sreyda

texts.en:
Sreyda is 31 years old. She is married and resides with one child in Kampong Speu Province, Cambodia. To earn a living, her husband runs a barber shop. He earns about US$12 daily. 

Due to lack of funds, Sreyda is requesting a loan of US$1,000 to purchase construction materials to build a kitchen. This money will help her obtain a better place for cooking. 

In the future, she would like to run general store and send her child to a good school.

loans.use: to purchase construction materials to build a kitchen

loans.name: Mirvaidullo

texts.ru: Мирвайдулло 40 лет, женат, имеет двух сыновей. Он со своей семьей проживает в городе Исфара. Его жена работает в школе учительницей начальных классов. Старший сын студент. Он учится во втором курсе Государственного Технического Университета отделения информатики. Младший сын еще учится в школе. Сам Мирвайдулло работает старшим техником в пожарной службе. Одновременно он имеет доход с сада. Мирвайдулло в год с 5 га участка сада собирает 2500 кг яблок, которых после сушки на солнце выводит на продажу. Сейчас Мирвайдулло нуждается в кредите. Ему необходимо оплатить контракт сына за второй курс обучения в Университете. Он очень хочет, чтобы его сын успешно завершил ВУЗ и в будущем стал преподавателем.
texts.en:
Mirvaidullo is 40 years old, married, and has two sons. He lives in the city of Isfara together with his family. His wife works as a primary school teacher. His eldest son is a student. He is in the second year of Computer Science studies at the State Technical University. His youngest son still goes to school. 

Mirvaidullo himself works as a senior technician in the fire department. At the same time he has an income from his garden. He harvests 2500 kilos of apples from his plot of 5 hectares each year, which he sells after drying them in the sun. 

Currently Mirvaidullo needs a loan. He needs to pay tuition for his son's second year of study at the university. He would very much like for his son to complete college and in the future become a teacher.

loans.use: to pay tuition for his son's second year at university

loans.name: Leonora

texts.en:
Leonora is married, with three children. She is 47 years old and lives in Puntod, Plaridel, Misamis Occidental, Philippines.

Leonora is a farmer and grows vegetables to earn a living. She has been doing this for 10  years. 

She has requested a loan to purchase farm inputs like fertilizer and pesticide.

Leonora has been a member of PMPC for 13 years. In the future, she hopes to have enough savings for her children's education .

loans.use: to pay for fertilizer and pesticides.

loans.name: Omonjon

texts.ru: Омончон житель города Турсунзаде. Ему 36 лет. Он отец и женатый мужчина. Его родители были фермерами, и он тоже унаследовал их профессию. Омончон большую часть своей жизни провел работая на земле. Он занимается земледелием более 20 лет. Недавно он приобрел орошаемое поле, где еще ранее ничего не сеялось. Омончон хочет обработать землю и посадить картофель. По этой причине он обратился за кредитом, чтобы приобрести семена картофеля. Он очень хочет успеть посадить картошку к осени. Помогите Омончону реализовать его цель.
texts.en:
Omonjon is a resident of the city of Tursun-zoda. He is 36 years old. He is a father and a husband. His parents were farmers, and he followed them in their profession. 

Omonjon spent the larger part of his life working in the field. He has worked with field crop cultivation for more than 20 years. Not long ago he purchased irrigated land, where previously nothing was sown. Omonjon would like to process the land and sow potatoes. For this reason he applied for a loan in order to purchase potato seeds. 

Omonjon would very much like to succeed in sowing potatoes before the fall comes. Help Omonjon realize his dream!

loans.use: to purchase potato seeds

loans.name: Maribeth

texts.en:
Maribeth is married with two children. Maribeth is 37 years old and lives in Puntod, Plaridel, Misamis Occidental, Philippines.

Maribeth is a farmer and grows vegetables to earn a living. She has been doing this for 10 years. She has requested a loan to purchase farm inputs like fertilizers and pesticide.

Maribeth has been a member of PMPC for two years. In the future, Maribeth hopes to have a rice farm of her own.

loans.use: to pay for fertilizers and pesticides.

loans.name: Vilma

texts.en:
Vilma is married with four children. Vilma is 42 years old and lives in Puntod, Plaridel, Misamis Occidental, Philippines.

Vilma raises ducks and sell them to customers  to earn a living. She has been doing this for 10 years. She has requested a loan to purchase various feeds.

Vilma has been a member of PMPC for nine years. In the future, Vilma hopes to have enough savings for her family's future .

loans.use: to pay for various feeds.

loans.name: Teresita

texts.en:
This is Teresita, 45, a resident of Silang, Cavite, Philippines. She is married to Antonio, a worker abroad, and they have children. She manages their household while operating the business. She is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.

Teresita operates a variety store. In the Philippines, a variety store is a retail store that sells inexpensive items, often with a single price for all items in the store. It is the place to go to buy one sachet of shampoo, a 5 PHP-worth amount of cooking oil or an egg. She earns by getting supplies at wholesale prices and selling by the piece. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of PHP 900 in sales every day.

Teresita is requesting a PHP 15,000 loan to help her continue in the operation of her business. She will use the loan to buy groceries, toiletries and beverages to expand her product inventory.

Teresita hopes that her business will continue to flourish and dreams that her children will have a good future. She meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her life and business every week. There she can also draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and the Word of God she studies.

*All CCT community partnersclients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: To pay for grocery items, toiletries and beverages needed in her business.

loans.name: Daniela Silvia

texts.es: La Sra. Daniela sigue con la misma actividad dl servicio de copiado de llaves, cuenta que le fue bien con el anterior crédito ya que lo utilizo en la compra  de distintos modelos de llaves para su negocio,  en esta ocasión solicita el crédito para la compra de herramientas que le ayudaran a hacer un buen copiado de llaves,  se siente feliz y agradecida por la oportunidad que le dan para crecer en su negocio.
texts.en: Daniela continues to do the same work cutting keys.  She tells us that her last loan was used well as she bought different key models for her business.  On this occasion, Daniela is applying for a loan to buy tools that will help her cut keys well.  Daniela is happy and grateful for this opportunity to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy tools for cutting keys.

loans.name: Cristina Del Carmen

texts.es:
Cristina, se ha decidido por otro crédito para invertir más en su tienda comprara jugos, sodas arroz, frijoles, aceite, maíz, etc. Ella se siente agradecida por la confianza que se le dio anteriormente; administro muy bien su crédito ha hecho crecer su clientela por lo que la demanda que tiene hoy en día es de diversificar los productos que tiene a  la venta.
Cristina con su tienda está generando ganancias que le han ayudado a salir adelante con sus compromisos familiares.
texts.en:
Cristina has decided to apply for another loan in order to invest more in her shop.  She will buy juices, fizzy drinks, rice, beans, oil, corn, and more items.  Cristina feels very grateful for the trust that has previously been put in her.  Cristina manages her loan well and has increased her customer business.  There is now demand to diversify what products she offers.

Cristina is using the shop to generate an income, which has helped her to get ahead and support her family.

loans.use: to buy juices, fizzy drinks, rice, beans, oil, corn, and more items.

loans.name: Marlen Yamileth

texts.es:
Marlen, busca nuevamente capital para su negocio de venta de medicinas, con el cual comprara vitaminas para el apetito, el cerebro y medicamentos para el estómago. Ella tiene mayor demanda de distintos productos que necesita surtir lo más pronto posible, pues sus clientes han aumentado, sus ingresos son mayores.
Ella hoy puede ofrecer una calidad de vida mejor a su familia, gracias a que su negocio esta produciendo lo necesario para los gastos familiares.
texts.en:
Marlen is again looking for capital for her business selling medicines.  With the loan, she will buy vitamins for appetite, for the brain, and medicines for the stomach.  Marlen has more demand for different products which she needs to stock as soon as possible.  Her number of customers has increased and her income is higher.

Marlen can today offer her family a better life, thanks to her business, which is generating an income to cover family costs.

loans.use: to buy vitamins for appetite, for the brain, and medicines for the stomach.

loans.name: Hassel

texts.en:
Hassel is 55-years-old and widowed with four children.

Hassel works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 20,000 loan through Kiva partner NWTF in order to purchase more groceries to sell.

Hassel has been in this business for 16 years and has previously received funds through Kiva.

Hassel aspires to save money to expand her business and repair her family home.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Josefa

texts.en:
Josefa is 20 years old, and she is married. She has a shop to generate income for her family. She has been thinking about how to run a big business but she does not have enough working capital. 

She felt better when she applied for her first loan, and now she is applying for her second loan of US$ 1,000.  She will buy some additional supplies to keep in her store, such as traditional clothes. She is happy with TRM (Tuba Rai Metin) that it offers loans to poor people.

loans.use: To buy traditional clothes for her shop

loans.name: Jocelyn

texts.en:
Jocelyn is 42-years-old and married with one child.

She earns a living by raising pigs in the Philippines. Jocelyn is borrowing PHP 14,000 through Kiva partner NWTF in order to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Jocelyn has been raising pigs for six years and also earns additional income from a general store.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream, to save enough money to build a convenience store at the public market.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Sheryl

texts.en:
This is Sheryl, 35, a resident of Silang, Cavite, Philippines. Her partner is Antonio and they have child. She, together with her partner, manages their household while operating the business. They are both working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.

Sheryl operates a variety store. In the Philippines, a variety store is a retail store that sells inexpensive items, often with a single price for all items in the store. It is the place to go to buy one sachet of shampoo, a Php5-worth of cooking oil, or an egg. She earns by getting supplies at wholesale prices and selling by pieces.
