También se dedica a  la costura, oficio que aprendió estudiando en un centro de educación ocupacional, para luego comprar una maquina de coser  y una máquina remalladora con sus ahorros, la cual instaló en su hogar,  donde atiende a sus clientes, quienes la buscan por sus buenos acabados, logrando ganarse  su aceptación y así la recomiendan con otras personas que luego se vuelven en sus clientes habituales. Se inicio hace mas de  01 año en éste negocio, realizándolo sola, pero gracias a la venta de bebidas gasificadas puede apoyar a su esposo a solventar los gastos de su hogar. Este es su cuarto préstamo con Kiva y se siente agradecida por el apoyo financiero que recibe para seguir adelante, además se compromete a pagar sus cuotas de manera puntual. Con el monto solicitado de 1500 nuevos soles, los invertirá en comprar  bebidas gasificadas al por mayor y materiales de costura como telas, hilos, botones.
texts.en:
Damaris, 32, is married to Odilo and lives with her two children, her grandfather, and her husband in her own house, which she build with a lot of effort.

Damaris earns a living selling carbonated beverages in various brands and flavors.  She also makes a living sewing, which she learned in a vocational education center.  Later she bought a sewing machine and a darning machine with her savings and set them up in her house, where she serves her customers.  They always seek her out because of her good work.  She earns their approval, so they recommend her to other people who later become steady customers.

Damaris started this business more than a year ago and does it alone.  Thanks to the sale of carbonated beverages, though, she can help her husband with the household expenses.

This is Damaris's fourth Kiva loan.  She's grateful for the financial support she receives so she can get ahead, and she promises to make her payments punctually.

Damaris will invest the requested amount of 1500 nuevos soles [PEN] in carbonated beverages wholesale and sewing supplies such as fabric, thread, and buttons.

loans.use: to buy carbonated beverages and sewing supplies

loans.name: Astghik

texts.en:
Astghik is a farmer from the village of Amberd in the Armavir region. She lives with her husband, her son, her daughter-in-law, and  her two-year-old grandchild. Astghik and her family are engaged in breeding hens and in cultivation of beans, cucumbers, and strawberries. Farming is the only source of the family’s income. Astghik’s husband and son help her sell the agricultural products in the local market. 

Astghik currently needs a loan of $1500 to purchase some fertilizer and other materials, such as cellophane and bottles, needed for cultivation of plants and strawberries. Astghik and her family will be very grateful to all the lenders for their good will and support, helping them collect the needed amount of loan for developing their agribusiness.

loans.use: to purchase some fertilizer and other materials, such as cellophane and bottles, needed for cultivation of plants and strawberries

loans.name: Nkanga 2 Tukore Group

texts.en: Christine, a mother of three, does small scale farming and also sells groceries. She said she ventured into this because there was high demand among the town dwellers. She thanks Ugafode for giving their group money each time they need it and is grateful that Kiva lenders are also willing to partner with them. She will use the loan to buy seeds and pesticides for the vegetables that she grows at her homestead. She is hardworking and wants to grow the project to a bigger level. She is hardworking and urges fellow women to become involved in income generating activities.

loans.use: To buy seeds and pesticides.

loans.name: Gulsunay

texts.ru: Гулсунай 49 лет, замужем, вместе с супругом воспитывают 2 детей. У Гулсунай - среднее образование, в качестве основного дохода для своей семьи Гулсунай занимается животноводством, стартовав 29 лет назад, с покупки скота на 2,000 сом KGS. Благодаря упорному труду Гулсунай, в ее хозяйстве на сегодняшний день имеется: 1 дойная корова, а также в собственности имеет 2,10 ГА поливной земли, на которой ежегодно сажает фасоль и клевер. Ежемесячный доход составляет 12,000 сом (KGS). В целях дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, Гулсунай обратилась в Микрофинансовый банк «Бай –Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 100,000 сом (KGS) на покупку коров для увеличения поголовья скота. Доходы от кредита Гулсунай планирует вложить в дальнейшее приумножение количества домашней скотины, и планирует накопить средства на дальнейшее обучение детей.
texts.en:
Gulsunay is 49 years old, married, and she and her husband are raising 2 children.  Gulsunay has a secondary level education.  The main source of income for Gulsunay's family is her animal husbandry business, which she started 29 years ago with the purchase of 2,000 somi (KGS) worth of cattle.  As a result of Gulsunay's hard work, today Gulsunay has one milking cow and 2.1 HA of irrigated land where every year she grows beans and clover.  Her monthly income comes to 12,000 somi (KGS).

With the goal of further developing her business, Gulsunay applied to microfinance bank Bai Tushum & Partners for a loan of 100,000 somi (KGS) to increase the size of her herd by buying cattle.  Gulsunay plans to invest the profits from her loan in further increasing the size of her herd and to save up money for her children's education.

loans.use: to buy cows

loans.name: Florinda

texts.es: Florinda, de 53 años es madre de dos hijos, los cuales ya son independientes, vive en su casa propia desde donde lucha continuamente para mejorar su nivel de vida. Florinda se dedica a la confección de prendas de vestir de diferentes telas. Ella ha establecido poco a poco su pequeño pero muy productivo taller en su casa en donde diseña y refacciona diferentes prendas de vestir. Cuenta que hace tiempo trabajaba con una señora que distribuía sus prendas de vestir en un conocido centro comercial de la ciudad, pero con el paso de los años se dio cuenta que ella también podría realizar sus propios diseños y es así como emprendió esta nueva etapa. Trabaja ya 10 años en este negocio y desde que empezó se ha mantenido estable. Lo que mas le gusta de su trabajo es que todos los días su dinero esta en movimiento y eso genera ingresos diarios, además de disponer de su tiempo. En esta oportunidad solicitará S/. 800, está muy agradecida por el apoyo financiero que recibe para seguir adelante, además se compromete a pagar sus cuotas de manera puntual. Con el monto solicitado comprará telas, hilos y elásticos que usa en su trabajo diario.
texts.en:
Florinda, 53, is the mother of two children who are already independent.  She lives in her own house, where she strives continually to improve her standard of living.

Florinda earns a living making garments of different fabrics.  Little by little she has set up her small but very productive workshop in her house, where she designs and makes a variety of garments.  She says that some time ago she used to work with a woman who distributed her garments in a well-known shopping center in the city.  In time, however, Florinda realized that she could make her own designs, which is how she started on this new phase.

She has worked for 10 years in this business, which has been stable since she began.  What she likes most about her job is that her cash is flowing every day, which generates a daily income.

Currently Florinda will request 800 nuevos soles [PEN].  She's very grateful for the financial support she receives to get ahead and promises to make her payments punctually.

With the requested amount she'll buy fabric, thread, and elastic, which she uses in her daily work.

loans.use: to buy fabric, thread, and elastic

loans.name: Beatrice

texts.en:
Beatrice lives outside of Kakamega town, in Kakamega county. Kakamega is located in Western Kenya and is famous for the Kakamega Forest, the only tropical rain forest in Kenya. It is a very good location for beekeeping due to the old growth trees in the forest and the concentration of farms in the area, which provide bees with a variety of forage. 

Beatrice is married, and has four children. Both she and her husband have been farming for five years, and are currently growing vegetables and napier grass, an interesting grass that acts as a high-protein fodder for livestock as well as part of a pest prevention strategy by ‘pulling’ pests towards it and away from other food crops. She likes beekeeping because it is an income-generating activity that requires little hard work. 

This is Beatrice’s first loan with Kiva, and she plans to use the income from her hives to buy a dairy cow. Her hope for the future is to buy land and expand her farm.

loans.use: to buy beehives for honey production.

loans.name: Livine

texts.en:
Livine is 35 years old. She is the mother of two children ages 8 and 12.  Her children both attend school. 

Livine sells various items in her boutique and has been running the boutique for the past five years. With the loan she would like to buy more beans, sorghum and other items for resale.

loans.use: To buy more boutique items for sale.

loans.name: Gladys

texts.en:
Gladys lives and works outside of Kakamega town in Kakamega County. Kakamega County is located in Western Kenya close to the Ugandan border. It contains the only tropical rain forest in Kenya. The variety of the flora in the region makes it well-suited for beekeeping. It also has one of the highest rural population densities in the world (nearly 600 people per square kilometer in some areas).  This may contribute to the region's high poverty rates.  

Gladys is married and has seven children and many grandchildren. Her husband works as a pastor and she farms their land. She has been farming for 23 years and is currently growing vegetables, maize and sugarcane on her land. Gladys loves eating honey on bread and is looking forward to having her own hives so that she can eat fresh honey. 

This is Gladys’ first loan with Kiva, and she plans to use the income from her hives to “take care of [some of] my grandchildren because the parents are not around.” Gladys’ hope for the future is to “live a stress-free life and for my children to get jobs.”

loans.use: to buy beehives for honey production.

loans.name: Walter

texts.en:
Walter lives near Kakamega town in Kakamega county, located in Western Kenya. This county is famous for having the only tropical rain forest in the country. Most farmers in Kakamega grow maize, but sugar cane, papaya, bananas and tea are also popular crops. The variety of crops grown in the region, as well as the abundance of vegetation in the old growth forest, make Kakamega particularly attractive for beekeeping. 

Walter is married and has three children. Both him and his wife have been farming for six years, and are currently growing vegetables, beans and maize on her land. Walter thinks that beekeeping is a good project because it generates income from land without too much work. 

This is Walter’s first loan with Kiva, and he plans to use the income from his hives to educate his children. His hope for the future is “for my children to finish school and to buy more hives for more income.”

loans.use: to buy beehives for honey production.

loans.name: Silvanus

texts.en:
Silvanus lives on a farm outside of Kakamega town, in Kakamega county. Kakamega is located in western Kenya, and is famous for the Kakamega Forest, the only tropical rain forest in Kenya. It is a very good location for beekeeping, due to the old growth trees in the forest and concentration of farms in the area, which provide bees with a variety of forage. 

Silvanus is married, and has three children. His wife runs a small business, while Silvanus farms their land. He has been farming for 15 years, and is currently growing maize and vegetables on his land. He is looking forward to starting beekeeping, as it is a good income-generating project that allows him to make full use of his land. 

This is Silvanus’ first loan with Kiva, and he plans to use the income to pay his children’s school fees. Silvanus’ hope for the future is to “buy a car and become a successful farmer.”

loans.use: to buy beehives for honey production.

loans.name: Alima

texts.ru: Алиме 57 лет, вдова, после смерти мужа сама воспитывает 2 детей, а также ведет свое хозяйство. У Алимы - среднее образование, в качестве основного дохода для своей семьи Алима занимается животноводством, стартовав 14 лет назад, с покупки скота на 8,000 сом KGS. Благодаря упорному труду Алимы, в ее хозяйстве на сегодняшний день имеется: 2 дойные коровы, 10 овец. Ежемесячный доход составляет 15,000 сом (KGS). В целях дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, Алима обратилась в Микрофинансовый банк «Бай –Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 50,000 сом (KGS) на покупку коров для откорма с последующей реализацией на рынке по высокой цене. Доходы от кредита Алима планирует вложить в дальнейшее приумножение количества домашней скотины.
texts.en:
Alima is 57 years old and a widow.  Since her husband's death, she alone has been raising their two children as well as running her own business.  Alima has a secondary level education and her family's main source of income is Alima's animal husbandry business, which she started 14 years ago with the purchase of 8,000 somi (KGS) worth of cattle.  As a result of her hard work, today Alima has 2 milking cows and 10 sheep.  Her monthly income comes to 15,000 somi (KGS).

With the goal of further developing her business, Alima applied to microfinance bank Bai Tushum & Partners for a loan of 50,000 somi (KGS) to buy cows for fattening and reselling at the market at a good price.  Alima plans to invest the profits from her loan in further increasing the size of her herd.

loans.use: to buy cows for fattening and reselling

loans.name: Gabriel

texts.en:
Gabriel lives outside of Kakamega town in Kakamega County. Kakamega County is located in Western Kenya and is famous for its rain forest. Many farmers in the area grow maize, sugar cane and bananas. Maize is the primary crop. The density of the old growth trees in the Kakamega forest and the variety of crops grown in the area make this an excellent area for beekeeping. 

Gabriel is married and has six children. He and his wife both engage in projects on their land. They are currently tending to dairy cows and growing vegetables. Gabriel is excited to become a beekeeper and he says “I love farming and I want to try beekeeping.”

This is Gabriel’s first loan with Kiva and he plans to use the income to pay his children’s school fees. His hope for the future is to “build a nice house.”

loans.use: to buy beehives for honey production.

loans.name: Salihe

texts.en:
Salihe is a 51-year-old Roma woman who has been selling second-hand clothing at the Roma market for the past ten years. She lives in a major city in the central Albania, and is the only one in the family to bring an income home.The market where she sells is the biggest in Albania, and the most popular. 

Every Roma who uses this market has pitched in money to build their booth; they also shared expenses on the common areas. Some of them even live there; they have some open concept, let’s say sort of rooms, with no water, toilets, or a kitchen. It’s just some beds on the floor, and these rooms serve as fitting rooms if needed. 

The quality of clothes though is very good, because the majority of clothes are not donated, but are sold by kilos from stores from the nearby western countries. Romas are good at doing this type of activity.

Salihe wants to stock up on seasonal inventory items with this loan.

loans.use: to stock up on inventory items

loans.name: Ama

texts.en:
Although she has received no prior formal education, Ama is an entrepreneur. She specializes in selling palm oil and kernel in Twa (near Cape Coast). She has been involved in this enterprise for six years. 

Ama is married and has four children; her husband is a trader. 

The proceeds from her business normally go towards helping her husband cover the family’s general expenses, and paying for their children’s school fees. 

Ama will use the loan to purchase increased amounts of palm oil and kernel, thus helping her improve her overall sales. 

With the new profits from her expanded business, Ama plans to further diversify the type of products that she sells, hence adapting to changing customer preferences.

loans.use: to purchase increased amounts of palm oil and kernel, thus aiding her to improve her overall sales

loans.name: Khaled

texts.en: Khaled is an 18-year-old single man from Jabalia city. He lives with his family in a simple house. Khaled finished his school this year with a very good grades and he will regester in the university. Khaled would like to take the BA and maybe study for a higher degree in the future so he can find a good job and help his family in the future. Khaled took a USD loan from FATEN. This loan will help him to buy a new laptop for his university study, and will help him to write reports and do his homework. Khaled appears in the photo with his new laptop.

loans.use: to buy a new laptop for his university study

loans.name: Ama

texts.en: Although she has received no prior formal education, Ama is an entrepreneur. She specializes in operating a provision store in Twa (near Cape Coast). She has been involved in this enterprise for 6 years. Ama is married and has 6 children. Her husband is a farmer. The proceeds from her business normally go towards helping her husband cover the family’s general expenses and pay their children’s school fees. Ama will use the loan to purchase increased amounts of provisions, thus aiding her to improve her overall sales. With the new profits from her expanded business, Ama plans to further diversify the type of products that she sells, hence adapting to changing customer preferences.

loans.use: to purchase increased amounts of provisions for resale

loans.name: Ahmad

texts.en: Ahmad is a 21-year-old single man from Jabalia city. He lives with his family in a simple house. His father is a worker and this is the only source of income to the family. Ahmad is still a student in a local college where he studies science. Ahmad would like to finish his study with very high grades so he can find a good job and help his family in the future. Ahmad took a USD Murabaha loan from FATEN. This loan will help him to buy a new laptop for his study, and will help him to use specific programs to do his projects and homework. Ahmad appears in the photo with his new laptop.

loans.use: to buy a new laptop for his study

loans.name: Saidali

texts.ru: Сайдали житель района А.Джоми, занимающийся растениеводством. Ему 27 лет. Он семьянин и отец двух детей. Сайдали имеет 0,30 га приусадебного и президентского участка земли, на котором выращивает огородные культуры. Он занимается этим с юного возраста еще когда помогал отцу и уже 15 лет как он работает на земле. За этот большой промежуток времени он приобрел огромный опыт земледелия. Параллельно он еще и занимается животноводством. Сайдали сейчас готовится к осеннему посеву. Он запрашивает кредит, чтобы закупить ГСМ, минеральные удобрения, семена картофеля, помидора и огурцов. С полученной прибыли он хочет отремонтировать свою машину, которая служит ему для перевозки урожая на рынок с целью продажи.
texts.en:
Saidali is 27 years old and lives in the A. Jomi region and is in the farming business.  He is a family man and the father of two children.  Saidali has 0.3 HA of personal and granted land where he grows garden crops.  He has been doing this since a young age when he helped his father.  He has been working on the land for 15 years.  Over this long period of time, he has gained a wealth of experience in farming.  Along with farming, he also raises cattle.  

Saidali is now getting ready for an autumn planting.  He is requesting a loan in order to buy fuel oils, mineral fertilizers, and potato, tomato, and pepper seed.  Saidali wants to use the profits he earns to overhaul the truck he uses to carry his harvest to market for sale.

loans.use: to buy fuel, fertilizer, and seed

loans.name: Aida

texts.en:
Aida is an experienced farmer from the village Sarakap in the Shirak region. Her family consists of her husband, two sons, a daughter-in-law and a one-year-old grandchild. 

Aida and her family earn a living through farming which is the only source of income for them. They breed a livestock of cows, sheep and hens. Aida’s husband and sons help her get the agricultural products to the local market. Aida now wants to start cultivating wheat. The family’s agribusiness needs some investments to function in a sustainable way. 

A loan of $3000 USD will be very helpful by enabling them to purchase wheat seeds, to buy forage for the livestock, to purchase fuel and to pay for technical services. Aida and her family depend on the good will of the lenders and are very thankful to them for helping to sustain their agribusiness.

loans.use: to purchase wheat seeds, to buy forage for the livestock, to purchase fuel and to pay for technical services

loans.name: Yelena

texts.en:
Yelena is an experienced farmer from the village of Sarnakunk in the Syunik region. She lives with her husband, son and school-age daughter. Yelena's husband and son work in the private sector. However, their salaries are so low that they cannot fully meet the family's needs. 

To be able to cover the family's expenses, Yelena in engaged in breeding a livestock of cows, sheep, pigs, piglets and hens. She is also cultivating beech, potato and grass. Farming is an important source of income for the family. 

To be able to run the agribusiness in a sustainable way, Yelena currently needs a loan of $2,000 USD to purchase fuel for agricultural machinery and to buy some forage for the livestock. Yelena and her family depend on the good will of the lenders and are grateful to them for helping to provide the loan for developing their agribusiness.

loans.use: to purchase fuel for agricultural machinery and to buy some forage for the livestock

loans.name: Kashenyi Group

texts.en:
Kashenyi Tukwatanise group is located a few kilometres away from-Ibanda town council. It is comprised of mainly women who range in different categories of married, singles, divorced and widows.

Loyce is a single mother who divorced from her husband due to family problems. She is operating a grocery in a busy market and has three children. She struggles to take care of the children and other family necessities since she does all this single-handedly. She requested a loan of UGX 500,000 to help her add more stock of groceries in her business and use the rest of the money to pay rent and tuition for her children. Her major challenge is lack of a permanent place of work since she is still renting which affects her cash flow. She is a hard working lady striving hard to provide a good future for her children.

.

loans.use: To buy groceries for resale

loans.name: Abena

texts.en:
Due to difficult circumstances, Abena did not have access to any form of formal education, yet that handicap has not stopped her from achieving her dream of becoming an entrepreneur. 

Currently, Abena sells rice and beans in Twa (near Cape Coast). She has been doing so for about two years. She is married to a carpenter, and together they have four children. Abena uses all her income to feed and provide for her family. 

Abena will use the loan to buy more rice and beans, which will aid her in improving her overall sales. 

Abena wants to use the future profits from her expanded business to ensure that all her children are able to receive an education.

loans.use: to buy more rice and beans, which will help in improving her sales

loans.name: Shabaan

texts.en: Shabaan is an 18-year-old single man from Jabalia city. He lives with his family in a simple house. His father is a worker and this is the only source of income to the family. Shabaan is a student in his first year in a local collage where he studies human science. Shabaan would like to finish his study with very high grades so he can find a good job and help his family in the future. Shabaan took a USD Murabaha loan from FATEN. This loan will help him to buy a new laptop for his study, and will help him to do his projects and homework. Shabaan appears in the photo with his new laptop.

loans.use: to buy a new laptop for his study

loans.name: Abena

texts.en: Although she has received no prior formal education, Abena is an entrepreneur. She specializes in selling charcoal in Twa (near Cape Coast). She has been involved in this enterprise for 6 years. Abena is married and has 3 children. Her husband is a farmer. The proceeds from her business normally go toward helping her husband cover the family’s general expenses and pay their children’s school fees. Abena wants to use her loan to increase her current inventory levels, thus allowing her to sell greater quantities of charcoal. In the long term, Abena plans to reinvest future profits into her business, helping her expand and meet the needs of rising customer demands.

loans.use: to increase her current inventory levels, allowing her to sell greater quantities of charcoal.

loans.name: Dorcas

texts.en: Although she has received no prior formal education, Dorcas is an entrepreneur. She specializes in selling locally made pastry in Beahu (near Takoradi). She has been involved in this enterprise for 10 years. Dorcas is married and has 6 children. Her husband is a manager at BOB plantations. The proceeds from her business normally go towards helping her husband cover the family’s general expenses and pay their children’s school fees. Dorcas wants to use her loan to increase her current inventory levels, hence allowing her to sell greater quantities of local pastries. In the long term, Dorcas plans to reinvest future profits into her business, thus helping her expand and meet the needs of rising customer demands.

loans.use: to increase her current inventory levels, allowing her to sell more pastries

loans.name: Gladys

texts.en:
Gladys is a small scale food vendor and soft drinks retailer in Beahu (near Cape Coast). She has had some form of formal education; she is a middle School graduate. She is married and has three children. Her husband is a teacher. Gladys has been working as a food vendor and soft drink retailer for close to seven years. Her income is used to help her husband pay the utility bills and their children’s school fees. 

Gladys plans on using her loan to purchase more ingredients to prepare more food, thus allowing her to meet rising customers’ demands. She hopes to use the profits from her enterprise to fulfill her dream of buying a food stand, helping her sell from a fixed location in the future.

loans.use: to purchase more ingredients to prepare more food, thus allowing her to meet rising customers’ demands.

loans.name: Norbibi

texts.ru: Норбиби 46 лет. Она живет с семьей в городе Турсунзаде. Но большую часть времени она проводит на дороге.  Норбиби занимается продажей тканей и материалов для шитья одежды. Она закупает свой товар с города Душанбе и перепродает их в отдаленных деревнях и селах в таких районах, как Яван, Шахритус, Кубодиён, Вахш, Хуросон и до самого Памира. Норбиби такой деятельностью занимается около 20 лет. Она любит свою работу и хочет продолжить свою торговую деятельность. Норбиби просит кредит, чтобы закупить партию тканей, если она на все свои сбережения купит ткани, ей не хватит средств  на дорогу. Норбиби надеется на вашу поддержку!
texts.en:
Norbibi is 46 years old and she and her family live in the city of Tursunzoda.  However, she spends most of her time on the road.  Norbibi sells fabric and materials for sewing clothes.  She buys her merchandise in the city of Dushanbe and resells it in distant villages and rural areas like Yavan, Sharihtus, Kubodien, Vahsh, and as far way as Pamir.  Norbibi has been in this business for about 20 years.  She loves her business and hopes to extend her business activities.

Norbibi is requesting a loan to buy a shipment of fabric because if she uses all her savings for the fabric, she will have no money left for business travel.  Norbibi is relying on your support!

loans.use: to buy fabric for resale

loans.name: Khurshed

texts.ru: Хуршед 28 летний фермер. Он начал свою земледельческую деятельность около 7 лет назад. На своей земле он занимается посевом овощей, в том числе помидоров, огурцов, лука и дополнительно сеит ячмень. Хуршед выкладывается на все сто. Он не жалеет сил и времени. Хуршед старается получить богатый урожай и продать его, чтобы прокормить семью. Ведь у него жена и маленькие дети. Его жена ухаживает за детьми, ведет домашнее хозяйство и дополнительно помогает мужу в деятельности. В данный момент Хуршед обратился за кредитом, чтобы закупить минеральные удобрения. Он хочет успеть обработать посеянные овощи, чтобы в дальнейшем собрать качественный и богатый урожай.
texts.en: Khurshed is a 28-year-old farmer who began working in agriculture about seven years ago. On his land he grows vegetables such as tomatoes, cucumbers and onions as well as barley. Khurshed gives 100% to everything and doesn't spare his strength or time. He is trying to bring in a rich harvest and sell it in order to feed his family, as he has a wife and small children. His wife takes care of the children and the house and helps her husband in his business. At the moment Khurshed is requesting a loan to buy mineral fertilizers. He wants to succeed in growing the vegetables he has planted so that in the future he can gather a bountiful harvest.

loans.use: to buy mineral fertilizers for his vegetable farm

loans.name: Hawa

texts.en:
Meet 30-year-old Hawa from Jui eastern area in Freetown. She is married with 4 children. In 2006, Hawa established her retail business. She did not got to school, and was trained in her business. She works at the business from 8:00am until 7:00pm, 7 days per week. She says that the main challenges to her business is sometime she finds it difficult to move around door to door selling her food commodities.

Hawa requires a loan in order to purchase rice, palm oil and cooking seasonings to expand her business. She hopes that the extra income from this loan will allow her to have a permanent business location and increase her business. In the future, Hawa plans to expand her business more. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to purchase rice, palm oil and cooking seasonings to expand her business.

loans.name: Sadia

texts.en: Sadia is single and has 2 children. Even though she did not receive any formal education, Sadia is a successful businesswoman. She sells groundnuts and maize in Twa (near Cape Coast). She has been actively involved in this business for about a year. As the sole breadwinner in the family, Sadia uses her income to provide for the entire family. Sadia will use the loan to purchase increased amounts of groundnut and maize, thus helping her to improve her overall sales. With the new profits from her expanded business, Sadia plans to further diversify the type of products that she sells in order to adapt to changing customer preferences.

loans.use: to purchase increased amounts of groundnut and maize, thus helping her to improve her overall sales.

loans.name: Amneh

texts.en: Amneh is a 53-year-old married woman from a small village near Ramallah city. She lives with her husband and two sons in a humble house.  Her husband is a worker with a very low wage, and her older son also works to help his family.  Amneh would like her son to finish his degree at the university where he is a second year studying Physical Education, so Amneh took a loan from FATEN. This loan will help her to pay the university tuition bills for her son and help him to finish his study so he can find a good job in the future. Amneh appears in the photo.

loans.use: to pay the university bills for her son.

loans.name: Joyce

texts.en: After graduating from Junior High School, Joyce decided to set up her own second-hand clothing business in Beahu (near Cape Coast). With over two years worth of experience, she is currently looking to expand her enterprise further. Unfortunately, she is limited due to a lack of funding. As a result, this loan will be used to help her purchase more second-hand clothing for resale. She aims to use the profits from her business to help support her husband (who is a businessman) with the upkeep of their house whilst ensuring that their two children are able to experience a better life.

loans.use: to help her purchase more second-hand clothing for resale.

loans.name: Agartha

texts.en: Although she has received no prior formal education, Agartha is an entrepreneur. She specializes in preparing and selling ‘Kenkey’ (a traditional Ghanaian dish made from corn dough wrapped in banana leaves). She usually sells her ‘Kenkey’ in Beahu (near the Cape Coast). She has been involved in preparing and selling ‘Kenkey’ for four years. Agartha is married and has four children. Her husband is a photographer. The proceeds from her business normally go towards helping her husband cover the family’s general expenses and pay their children’s school fees. Agartha wants to use her loan to purchase a greater quantity of maize, thus increasing her current inventory levels. As a result, this will allow her to sell greater quantities of her tasty ‘Kenkey’. In the long term, Agartha plans to reinvest the future profits back into her business, helping her expand and meet the needs of rising customer demands.

loans.use: to purchase a greater quantity of maize, thus increasing her current inventory levels.

loans.name: Sayora

texts.ru: Сайёра молодая незамужняя девушка в возрасте 21 года. Она живет с родителями в городе Турсунзаде. Сайёра сама зарабатывает на жизнь. Она предоставляет услуги швеи. Почти 5 лет Сайёра шьет женские национальные платья по заказу. Для шитья одного платья уходит много времени, потому что у Сайёры старая машинка та самая, которую вы видите на фотографии. Этой машинке около 30 лет и даже больше. Ее родители сами не помнят, когда ее покупали. Сайёра нуждается в новой, современной швейной машинке, но не может приобрести из-за нехватки финансов. Сайёра очень хочет новую машинку и действительно нуждается в вашей поддержке.
texts.en: Sayora is an unmarried young woman of 21. She lives with her parents in the city of Tursun-zoda. Sayora earns her living by offering sewing services. For almost five years she has been sewing women's national dresses to order. Sewing one dress takes a great deal of time, because Sayora has an old sewing machine, as you can see in the photo. This machine is at least 30 years old - even her parents don't remember when they bought it. Sayora needs a new, modern sewing machine, but has been unable to get one due to a shortage of funds. She really wants a new sewing machine and is relying on your support.

loans.use: to buy a modern sewing machine

loans.name: Marie

texts.en:
Meet 35-year-old Marie from Waterloo, in the eastern area of Freetown. She is married with two children aged seven and twelve years.   In 2009, Marie established a charcoal business. She began her business because she wants to take care of her family and become independent.  She works at her business from 8:00am until 7:00pm, 7 days per week. She says that the main challenge to her business is a lack of capital to expand her business.

Marie requires a loan in order to purchase more bags of charcoal to expand her business. She hopes that the extra income from this loan will allow her to change her living status and increase her business. In the future, Marie plans to expand her business more. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to purchase more bags of charcoal to expand her business.

loans.name: Isatu

texts.en:
Meet 36-year-old Isatu from Waterloo in the eastern area of Freetown. She is married with three children aged six and seventeen years old.  In 2003, Isatu established a gardening business. She began her business because she wants to create a source of income.  She works at her business from 8:00am until 7:00pm, seven days per week. She says that the main challenge to her business is a lack of capital to expand her business.

Isatu requires a loan in order to purchase more sodium, fertilizer and seeds for her gardening business. She hopes that the extra income from this loan will allow her to pay her children's school fees and build her business further. In the future, Isatu plans to expand her business more. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to purchase more sodium, fertilizer and seeds for her garden business.

loans.name: Isatu

texts.en:
Greetings from Sierra Leone! This is 35-year-old Isatu from Jui eastern area in Freetown. She is married with three children between the ages of three and fifteen years. Two of her children are attending school. She started her business because she wants to generate income to support her needs.

Isatu runs a cookery business; she sells cooked food at home. She has been running this business for three years. She works at the business eleven hours per day, seven days per week. Isatu says that the main challenge to her business is price inflation.

Isatu a has requested a loan in order to purchase food commodities like rice, coconut oil, cooking seasoning and soft drinks. The extra income from this loan will allow her to increase her capital and pay her children's school fees. In the future, she plans to open a big restaurant. She thanks you for your support

loans.use: to purchase food commodities like rice, coconut oil, cooking seasoning and soft drinks.

loans.name: Jamal

texts.ru: Жамал 51 год, вдова, после смерти мужа сама воспитывает троих детей, а также ведет свое хозяйство. У Жамал - среднее образование, в качестве основного дохода для своей семьи Жамал занимается животноводством, стартовав 22 года назад, с покупки скота на 3,000 сом KGS. Благодаря упорному труду Жамал, в ее хозяйстве на сегодняшний день имеется: 2 дойные коровы, 4 овцы. Ежемесячный доход составляет 6,000 сом (KGS). В целях дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, Жамал обратилась в Микрофинансовый банк «Бай –Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 20,000 сом (KGS) на покупку теленка для увеличения поголовья скота. Доходы от кредита Жамал планирует вложить в дальнейшее приумножение количества домашней скотины, и планирует накопить средства на дальнейшее обучение детей.
texts.en: Jamal is 51 years old, she is a widow. She is raising three children and also runs her own business after her husband's death. Jamal has secondary education and does animal husbandry as a main source of income for her family which she started 22 years ago with the purchase of livestock for 3,000 som (KGS). Because of her hard work Jamal now has two milk cows and four sheep. Her monthly income is 6,000 som. With the purpose to further grow her business Jamal has come to the microfinance bank Bai Tushum and Partners for a loan in the amount of 20,000 KGS to buy a calf to increase the headcount of cattle. Jamal plans to invest the income from the loan into further increase of the headcount of livestock and also save money for her children's education.

loans.use: to buy a calf.

loans.name: Adjoa

texts.en: Although she has received no prior formal education, Adjoa is an entrepreneur. She specializes in selling charcoal in Twa (near Cape Coast).  She has been involved in this enterprise for 3 years. Adjoa is married and has 8 children. Her husband is a farmer. The proceeds from her business normally go towards helping her husband cover the family’s general expenses and pay their children’s school fees. Adjoa wants to use her loan to increase her current inventory levels, allowing her to sell greater quantities of charcoal.  In the long term, Adjoa plans to reinvest future profits into her business, thus helping her expand and meet the needs of rising customer demands.

loans.use: to increase her current inventory levels, allowing her to sell greater quantities of charcoal.

loans.name: Kojo

texts.en: Even though Kojo grew up in poverty without an education, this has not stopped him from fulfilling his dream of achieving a better life for himself and his family.  Currently, Kojo is an entrepreneur who sells wooden boards in Twa (near Cape Coast).  His business enterprise has grown substantially since he began a year ago. He uses the income from his business to help his wife raise their 10 children.  Kojo has identified that there are growing demands among consumers for his product.  However, he is unable to meet their needs due to limited inventory capacity.  He therefore aims to use his loan to purchase more wooden boards to sell.  With the new profits from his expanded business, Kojo wants to buck the trend by ensuring that all his children will be given the opportunity to further distance their family from poverty.

loans.use: to purchase more wooden boards to sell.

loans.name: Fatmata

texts.en:
Fatmata is 35 years old and is from Waterloo in the area east of Freetown. She is married with 5 children. In 2008 Fatmata established a charcoal business. She began her business because she wanted to provide for her children's welfare.  She works at the business from 8 a.m. until 7 p.m. seven days per week. She says that the main challenge to her business is lack of capital to expand her business.

Fatmata requires a loan in order to purchase more bags of charcoal to expand her business. She hopes that the extra income from this loan will allow her to improve her standard of living and increase her business. In the future, Fatmata plans to continue to expand her business. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to purchase more bags of charcoal to expand her business.

loans.name: Agnes

texts.en: Although she has received no prior formal education, Agnes is an entrepreneur. She specializes in selling clothes in Beahu (near Cape Coast). She has been involved in this enterprise for 15 years. Agnes is married and has 2 children. Her husband works at port harbour. The proceeds from her business normally go towards helping her husband cover the family’s general expenses and pay their children’s school fees. Agnes wants to use her loan to increase her current inventory levels, hence allowing her to sell greater quantities of clothes. In the long term, Agnes plans to reinvest future profits into her business, thus helping her expand and meet the needs of rising customer demands.

loans.use: to increase her current inventory levels, allowing her to sell greater quantities of clothes

loans.name: Fatmata

texts.en:
Meet 49-year-old Fatmata from Jui eastern area in Sierra Leone. She is married with 8 children between the ages of 9 and 29 years. Ten years ago, Fatmata established her food retail business. She began her business because life was hard for her, so she decided to do business which will benefit her. She works at the business 12 hours per day and 7 days per week. She says her major hardship is insufficient capital to expand her business.

Fatmata requires a loan in order to purchase more flour, oil, ground nuts and sugar to prepare her cakes for sale. She hopes that the extra income from this loan will allow her to repay her loan and increase her business. In the future Fatmata, plans to send her children to university. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to purchase more flour, oil, ground nuts and sugar to prepare her cakes for sale

loans.name: Sarah

texts.en: Although she has received no formal education, Sarah is an entrepreneur.  She specializes in selling charcoal and raw rice in Twa (near Cape Coast).  She has been involved in this enterprise for 3 years. Sarah is married and has 6 children. Her husband is farmer.  The proceeds from her business normally go toward helping her husband cover the family’s general expenses and pay their children’s school fees. Sarah will use the loan to purchase increased amounts of charcoal and raw rice, thus helping her to improve her overall sales. With the new profits from her expanded business, Sarah plans to further diversify the type of products that she sells, thus adapting to changing customer preferences.

loans.use: to purchase increased amounts of charcoal and raw rice, thus helping her to improve her overall sales.

loans.name: Fatmeh

texts.en:
Fatmeh is a conservative person who prefers not to have her photo published online so her husband appears in the photo.
Fatmeh is a 25-year-old married woman from Jabalia city. She is a mother of one son and three daughters.  Her husband (pictured) is an employee in a local company and this is the only source of income for the family.  He gets a very low wage which is not enough to cover all of the family's needs.  Fatmeh and her husband would like to improve the family's living conditions but they do not have enough money for that, so Fatmeh took a loan from FATEN. This loan will help her to buy a solar system for heating water. The system will provide the family with hot water using clean and cheap power which will improve the family's living conditions.

loans.use: to buy a solar system for heating water.

loans.name: Lydia

texts.en:
After graduating from middle school, Lydia decided to set up her own maize, gari (starch dish) and groundnut business in Beahu (near Takoradi). With over a year's experience, she is now looking to expand her enterprise further. Unfortunately, she is limited due to a lack of funding. 

This loan will be used to help her by purchase more maize, gari and groundnut for resale. She intends to use the profits from her business to help support her husband (a driver) with the upkeep of their house and ensure that their 2 children are able to experience a better life.

loans.use: to purchase more maize, gari (starch dish) and groundnut for resale

loans.name: Samuel

texts.en: Although he has received no formal education, Samuel is an entrepreneur.  He is a tailor in Twa (near Cape Coast). He has been involved in this enterprise for 20 years. Samuel is married and has 8 children. His wife works as a trader.  The proceeds from his business normally go toward helping his wife cover the family’s general expenses and pay their children’s school fees. Samuel will use the loan to purchase sewing materials to expand his business. With the new profits from his expanded business, Samuel plans to further diversify the types of products that he sells, thus adapting to changing customer preferences.

loans.use: to purchase sewing materials to expand his business.

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Rosario

texts.en:
Rosario leads a women's cooperative known as To'ooneel Ixoq. They specialize in handwoven accessories and hammocks and would like to invest in a bulk purchase of raw materials, including string and natural dyes.  Rosario and the team have been selling through NOVICA since 2010. This is their story:

"We are a group of hard-working, creative and enterprising women with a desire to improve the lives of our family and our community," says Rosario, who serves as president of the association. "Our mothers taught us to weave when we were only little girls, and they also taught us how to dye threads with natural pigments to protect our environment. In fact, that is our specialty – our weaves are done with cotton threads dyed with tree bark, leaves and fruits. We go by the name To'ooneel Ixoq, which in the Tzutujil Maya language means 'Feminine Development.' We are a very united team, and the most beautiful thing about being in this team is that we support each other, and we encourage members to create their own designs. Our dream is to one day have our own store and a community workshop, because at the moment we work from our own homes."

"I am very thankful to those who support us because it is very difficult to have enough capital this time of year to keep up with demand. With this microcredit, we will be able to invest in raw materials and continue working."

loans.use: to purchase raw materials for handwoven accessories and hammocks.

loans.name: Monica

texts.en: Monica is a small scale baker in Beahu (near Cape Coast). She is a Senior High School graduate. She is married and has 2 children. Her husband works in customer service for Vodafone. Monica has been working as a baker for some time now. Her income is used to help her husband pay the utility bills and their children’s school fees. She plans on using her loan to purchase an increased quantity of flour to make more bread, thus allowing her to meet rising customers’ demand. She hopes to use the profits from her enterprise to develop her business further and ensure that all her children receive an education.

loans.use: to purchase an increased quantity of flour to make more bread for customers

loans.name: Igorora Tutungukye Group

texts.en:
Doreen is a married woman with six children, four of whom are in school.  Two dropped out due to lack of tuition.

Doreen sells roasted plantain (Gonja) by the road side. Her customers are passengers who stop over to buy something to eat. Her major challenge is harsh weather conditions like sunshine and rain, which disrupt her during her business operations since she has to sit by the road side waiting for her customers.

She runs her business with limited capital of ugx.100,000. She requested a loan of ugx.300,000 to add in her working capital so as to increase her cash flow. She will use the rest of the money to pay tuition for her children and buy them a few basic needs.
 
Despite all these challenges, Doreen is a very hard-working woman who is striving had to provide a good education and a good standard of living for her children.

loans.use: To buy plantain to sell

loans.name: Ama

texts.en: Although she has received no prior formal education, Ama is an entrepreneur. She specializes in preparing and selling ‘Banku’ (a traditional Ghanaian dish made using fermented corn/cassava dough that is mixed proportionally and cooked in hot water into a smooth whitish consistent paste), cocoa drink and bread. She usually sells her ‘Banku’ in Twa (near Cape Coast).  She has been involved in preparing and selling ‘Banku’ for 4 years.  Ama is married and has 10 children. Her husband works as a farmer. The proceeds from her business normally go toward helping her husband cover the family’s general expenses and pay their children’s school fees. Ama wants to use her loan to purchase a greater quantity of cassava and maize, thus increasing her current inventory levels. As a result, she will be able to sell greater quantities of her tasty ‘Banku’. In the long term, Ama plans to reinvest the future profits back into her business, thus helping her expand and meet the needs of rising customer demands.

loans.use: to purchase a greater quantity of cassava and maize, thus increasing her current inventory levels.

loans.name: Millicent

texts.en:
After graduating from junior high school, Millicent decided to set up her own business selling gari as well as other provisions. Gari is a traditional Ghanaian snack that is made from starched powdered cassava.

Millicent prepares her own gari and sells it and other provisions in Beahu (near Cape Coast). With over 2 years of experience, she is now looking to expand her enterprise further. Unfortunately, she is limited due to a lack of funding. 

This loan will be used to help her purchase more cassava, thus enabling her to prepare and sell more of her tasty gari as well as other provisions. She aims to use the profits from her business to help support her husband (a driver) with the upkeep of their house while ensuring that their 5 children are able to experience a better life

loans.use: to prepare and sell more of her tasty gari as well as other provisions

loans.name: Fatmata

texts.en:
Meet 30-year-old Fatmata from the Waterloo eastern area in Freetown. She is single with two children, ages 1 and 12 years old. In 2010, Fatmata established a charcoal business. She began her business because she wants to create a source of income for her living. She works at the business from 8:00am until 7:00pm, 7 days per week. She says that the main challenge to her business is lack of capital to expand her business.

Fatmata requires a loan in order to purchase more bags of charcoal to expand her business. She hopes that the extra income from this loan will allow her to change her status of living and increase her business. In the future, Fatmata plans to expand her business more. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to purchase more bags of charcoal to expand her business

loans.name: Agnes

texts.en: Although she has received no prior formal education, Agnes is an entrepreneur. She specializes in selling provisions in Beahu (near Cape Coast). She has been involved in this enterprise for 4 years. Agnes is married and has 2 children. Her husband is unemployed. The proceeds from her business normally go towards helping her husband cover the family’s general expenses and pay their children’s school fees. Agnes will use the loan to purchase increased amounts of provisions, thus aiding her to improve her overall sales. With the new profits from her expanded business, Agnes plans to further diversify the type of products that she sells, hence adapting to changing customer preferences.

loans.use: to purchase increased amounts of provisions, thus aiding her to improve her overall sales

loans.name: Modern Modern Group

texts.en:
The Modern Modern Group is located in the outskirts of Ibanda Town.  One of its members, Hellen, is a single mother who lost her husband in a fire accident in 2010. She was left with five children and she also takes care of her sister's two daughters who were abandoned by their mother. Hellen runs a small drug shop with small capital.  Besides that, she also has a small poultry farm where she gets income to boost her drug shop business.  She applied for a loan of 600,000 Ugandan shillings so as to buy poultry feed for her chickens and she plans to use the rest of the money to pay school fees for her children and provide the basic needs in life.
Her major challenges are insufficient capital to boost her business, thieves who steal her chicken, and diseases which affect her cash flow.  Despite all of these challenges, Hellen has been able to provide a good education and basic needs for her children.

loans.use: to buy poultry feed for her chickens.

loans.name: Ama

texts.en: Ama is divorced and has 4 children. Even though she did not receive any formal education, Ama is a successful businesswoman. She sells porridge in Twa (near Cape Coast). She has been actively involved in this business for about 8 years. As the sole breadwinner in the family, Ama uses her income to provide for the entire family. Ama will use the loan to purchase increased amounts of maize to prepare porridge, thus helping her to improve her overall sales.  With the new profits from her expanded business, Ama plans to further diversify the type of products that she sells, thereby adapting to changing customer preferences.

loans.use: to purchase increased amounts of maize to prepare porridge, thus helping her to improve her overall sales.

loans.name: Margret

texts.en:
Margret is 35 years old and is from Jui eastern area in Sierra Leone. She is married with 4 children. Margret has operated her food commodities business for more than 12 years. She began her business because she wanted to improve her standard of living. She works at the business 12 hours per day and 7 days per week. She says that her business is currently doing well.

Margret requires a loan in order to purchase more soft drinks, milk, biscuits and sugar for resale. She hopes that the extra income from this loan will allow her to repay her loan and increase her business. In the future Margret plans to open a bigger shop. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to purchase more soft drinks, milk, biscuits and sugar for resale

loans.name: Nana

texts.en:
Nana is divorced and has no children. Even though she did not receive any formal education, Nana is a successful businesswoman. 

She sells cooking pots in Beahu, which is near Cape Coast. She has been actively involved in this business for about ten years and is the sole breadwinner in her family. Nana will use the loan to purchase more cooking pots, which will aid her in increasing her overall sales. With the new profits from her expanded business, Nana plans to further diversify the types of products she sells and adapt to changing customer preferences.

loans.use: to purchase more cooking pots to sell

loans.name: Mercy

texts.en: Mercy is divorced and has 2 children.  After successfully graduating from middle school, Mercy is now an established businesswoman. She sells liquid soap, rice and flour products in Beahu (near Takoradi). She has been actively involved in this business for about 9 years. As the sole breadwinner in the family, Mercy uses her income to provide for the entire family. Mercy will use the loan to purchase increased amounts of liquid soap, rice and products, thus improving her overall sales.  With the new profits from her expanded business, Mercy plans to diversify the type of products that she sells and  adapt to changing customers preferences.

loans.use: to purchase increased amounts of liquid soap, rice and products, thus helping her to improve her overall sales.

loans.name: Finda

texts.en:
Finda is 30 years old and is from Jui eastern area in Sierra Leone. She is married with 2 children who are 8 and 12 years old. Finda has been operating  her food commodities business for more than 10 years. She began her business because she wanted to improve her standard of living. She works at the business 12 hours per day and 7 days per week. She says that she is currently facing high competition in the market.

Finda requires a loan in order to purchase more soft drinks, milk, biscuits and pure water for resale. She hopes that the extra income from this loan will allow her to repay her loan and increase her business. In the future Finda plans to open a bigger shop. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to purchase more soft drinks, milk, biscuits and pure water for resale

loans.name: Regina

texts.en: Although she has received no prior formal education, Regina is an entrepreneur. She specializes in selling shoes and slippers in Beahu (near Cape Coast). She has been involved in this enterprise for 2 years. Regina is married and has 3 children. Her husband works in a bar. The proceeds from her business normally go towards helping her husband cover the family’s general expenses and pay their children’s school fees. Regina will use the loan to purchase increased amounts of shoes and slippers, thus aiding her to improve her overall sales. With the new profits from her expanded business, Regina plans to further diversify the type of products that she sells, hence adapting to changing customer preferences.

loans.use: to purchase increased amounts of shoes and slippers, to improve her overall sales

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy a pick up truck, purification machines and more water bottles and racks, for distributing water to the community

loans.name: Richlore Abena

texts.en: Richlore Abena is single and has a child. After successfully graduating from Junior High School, Richlore is now an established businesswoman.  She sells cosmetics in Beahu (near Takoradi). She has been actively involved in this business for about 4 years. As the sole breadwinner in the family, Richlore uses her income to provide for the entire family. Richlore will use the loan to purchase increased amounts of cosmetics, thus helping her to improve her overall sales. With the new profits from her expanded business, Richlore plans to diversify the type of products that she sells, thereby adapting to changing customers preferences.

loans.use: to purchase increased amounts of cosmetics, thus helping her to improve her overall sales.

loans.name: Kate

texts.en: Kate is a food vender and maize seller in Beahu (near Takoradi).  Kate is a single and has a child.  As the sole breadwinner in the family, Kate uses her income to provide for the entire family.  Kate will use the loan to purchase increased amounts of maize, thus helping her to improve her overall sales. As a Junior High School graduate, Kate understands the importance of education in improving social conditions, so she plans to use the profits from her expanded enterprise to ensure that her children remain in school.

loans.use: to purchase increased amounts of maize which will help her to improve her sales.

loans.name: Cecilia

texts.en:
Cecilia lives in in Beahu, which is near Takoradi. After graduating junior high school, Cecilia decided to start her own local pastry and palm and coconut oil business.  

With over twenty years of experience, she is currently looking to further expand her enterprise. Unfortunately, she is limited by a lack of funding. This loan will allow her to prepare more local pastries and purchase more palm and coconut oil for resale. She aims to use her business profits to support her husband, a pensioner, in maintaining their house and ensuring that their four children are able to experience a better life.

loans.use: to help her by purchase and prepare more local pastry, palm oil and coconut oil for resale

loans.name: Cristobal

texts.en: Cristobal, a Tlaxcalan dairy farmer, is enthusiastic about using technology to improve his production. He's a pioneer and is often among the first in his community to try new practices or equipment, and he is excited about purchasing his Sistema Biobolsa biodigester. Currently, his dairy cows produce significant amounts of waste he wants to better utilize. With his 10 cubic meter Sistema Biobolsa biodigester, he will convert the abundant waste into renewable energy in the form of biogas and a potent biofertilizer, allowing him to reduce operating costs on the farm while maintaining or improving yields. This loan represents 45% of the total cost of his Sistema Biobolsa biodigester.

loans.use: to purchase a 10 cubic meter Sistema Biobolsa biodigester

loans.name: Heriberto

texts.en: Heriberto and his family live pretty much entirely on what they earn from farming and are constantly looking for ways to reduce costs and improve yields. Heriberto is investing in an 8 cubic meter Sistema Biobolsa biodigester in order to treat the abundant animal waste on-site to produce renewable biogas and potent biofertilizer. The methane-rich biogas will allow him to displace expensive, fossil-fuel based LP gas in the kitchen and bathroom and the biofertilizer will allow him to improve crop yields without having to purchase expensive agrochemical fertilizer. Concurrently, the digester will mitigate the amount of greenhouse gas generated by his animals. This loan represents 39% of the total cost of his Sistema Biobolsa biodigester.

loans.use: to purchase an 8 cubic meter Sistema Biobolsa biodigester

loans.name: Doris

texts.en: After graduating middle school, Doris decided to set up her own bread and coconut oil business in Beahu (near Takoradi).  With over 5 years worth of experience, she is currently looking to expand her enterprise further.  Unfortunately, she is limited due to a lack of funding.  As a result, this loan will be used to help her purchase more bread and coconut oil for resale. She aims to use the profits from her business to help support her husband (who is a farmer) with the upkeep of their house whilst ensuring that their 4 children are able to experience a better life.

loans.use: to purchase more bread and coconut oil for resale.

loans.name: Jose

texts.en:
Jose is a member of the group called El Sol sale para Todos 3, located in a rural area of the city of Hato Mayor. This is his 6th loan, which he will use to improve his house. He has a business of selling clothes and shoes, started with his first loan in Esperanza.

After his last loan, which he invested in his business, Jose realized the need to improve his home structure. With this housing loan he is able to take, and with his business profits, he can pay for the home improvements and save for more. The other members of his group are recommending him for a housing loan to start with the house construction. Now he will finish building his house by adding doors and windows, and cover the concrete block with cement.

Esperanza Internacional runs a program for their good clients who are reliable in paying back their loans, who have fulfilled the commitment to grow their business and who have shown fidelity in their groups. This allows them to take out a loan to improve the structure of their house at the same time as running their business and attending their group meetings. Jose lives together with his long term partner. He thanks God, Esperanza Internacional and all of you for this opportunity. In his name and that of his family, he thanks all of you for your support!

loans.use: To buy windows, doors, rods, cement and others construction material for his home

loans.name: Ophelia

texts.en: Ophelia is divorced and has a child.  After successfully graduating junior high school, Ophelia is now an established businesswoman.  She sells fish in Beahu (near Takoradi). She has been actively involved in this business for about 16 years. As the sole breadwinner in the family, Ophelia uses her income to provide for the entire family. Ophelia will use the loan to purchase increased amounts of fish, thus helping her to increase her overall sales. With the new profits from her expanded business, Ophelia plans to diversify the type of products that she sells, thereby adapting to changing customer preferences.

loans.use: to purchase increased amounts of fish, thereby increasing her overall sales.

loans.name: Estela

texts.en:
Estela is 35 years old, from Calabayan, Ozamiz City. She is very hardworking on running her used clothing business. She is married with 1 child who is school-age. The meager income of this "ukay-ukay" business has supported the daily needs of their family.

She has previously paid her loans in a timely fashion and now she is requesting for a loan of Php 8,000 to buy additional volume of stocks - used clothing for resale. Estela hopes to open more store outlets in the future.

loans.use: to buy clothing stock for resale

loans.name: Bunafsha

texts.ru: Бунафша молодая и жизнерадостная женщина. Ей 26 лет. Она разведена и не имеет детей. Бунафша имеет умелые руки. Она шьет национальные женские одежды. Бунафша занимается этим бизнесом более 3 лет. Она имеет своих клиентов и имеет хорошую репутацию среди местного населения.  Кроме того, как Бунафша шьет национальные одежды, она учится в институте. Она учится отлично и мечтает после окончания института стать хорошим специалистом и работать в государственной учреждении. Она запрашивает займ на сумму 3200 сомони для оплаты учебного договора.
texts.en:
Bunafsha is a young and cheerful woman. She is 26 years old. She is divorced and has no children. Bunafsha has skillful hands. She sews women's national clothing. Bunafsha has worked with this business for more than three years. She has her own clients and has a great reputation among the local population. 

Apart from sewing national clothing, Bunafsha studies at the institute. She studies well and dreams of becoming a specialist, working at a state institution, after graduating from the institute. She requests a loan in the amount of 3,200 somoni to pay her tuition.

loans.use: To pay her tuition

loans.name: Basilia

texts.en:
Basilia is 54 years old and widowed with two children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. 

Basilia has a tricycle transport business in the Philippines. Basilia requested a PHP 13,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy an additional tricycle for her business.

Basilia has been in this business for 16 years. Basilia would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy an additional tricycle for her business

loans.name: Cecilia

texts.en:
Cecilia works hard to support her family. Cecilia is married and has a buy and sell dried coconut meat business in the Philippines.

Cecilia requested a PHP 25,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more sacks of dried coconut meat to sell.

Cecilia has been in this business for 10 years now, and also earns additional income from firewood vending.

In the future, Cecilia would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more sacks of dried coconut meat to sell

loans.name: Cristina

texts.en:
Cristina is 53 years old and married. Cristina works very hard to provide for her family.

Cristina runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 29,500 loan through NWTF to buy additional stock of canned goods, detergent soap, shampoo, noodles, coffee, etc. to sell.

Cristina has been in this business for 20 years and sells a variety of items such as canned goods, detergent soap, shampoo, noodles, coffee, etc. 

Cristina would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy additional stock of canned goods, detergent soap, shampoo, noodles, coffee, etc. to sell

loans.name: Hilma

texts.en:
Hilma is 50 years old and has five children. Hilma is married and all five children are in school.

Hilma is in the agricultural poultry business in the Philippines. Hilma requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to purchase feed, vitamins and other supplies for her business.

Hilma has been in this business for 14 years now and has borrowed 7 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Hilma would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase feed, vitamins and other supplies for her business

loans.name: Sylvia

texts.en:
Sylvia’s housekeeping broker service, N&S Domestics, offering adult, child and pet care, as well as housekeeping, serves Austin and surrounding areas.

Her clients may schedule a cleaning of living areas, bedrooms and bathrooms.along with traditional sweeping and mopping, or other work as extensive as cleaning refrigerators, ovens, blinds, washing, folding and ironing, and silver and wood polishing. However, housework isn’t the only service N&S Domestics offers. 

Sylvia also offers individualized care for pets or family members.   A complete list and description of what Sylvia and her team offers are on her website: http://www.nsdomestics.com/.

“We are the first household agency in Travis and Hays County,” Sylvia says.  “Our mission is to implement the ethics of hard work into the agency policy and procedures to assist clients during screening processes.”   She adds that she carefully reviews and screens each job applicant before she assigns someone to serve a client.
 
Sylvia has an extensive amount of expertise in her field and her business continues to expand. At the beginning of September, she hired three full-time employees, bringing her total number of contractors to 13.  Sylvia knew that in order to continue growing, she would need to market her business.

After visiting the Austin Hispanic Chamber and Business Networking Inc., Sylvia was referred to Accion Texas Inc.  Her loan was used to purchase five billboards in the nearby Texas towns of Oak Hill and Kyle.

Sylvia is also on social media. Feel free to find her here: https://www.facebook.com/nsdomestics?fref=ts/ or https://twitter.com/nsdomestics/.

loans.use: to purchase five billboards.

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en: Although she has received no prior formal education, Elizabeth is an entrepreneur. She specializes in selling her food at chop bar eatery in Beahu (near Takoradi). She has been involved in this enterprise for 13 years. Elizabeth is married and has 2 children. Her husband works at a palm plantation. The proceeds from her business normally go toward helping her husband cover the family’s general expenses and pay their children’s school fees. Elizabeth wants to use her loan to increase her current inventory levels, thus allowing her to sell greater quantities of food. In the long term, Elizabeth plans to reinvest future profits into her business and expand and meet rising customer demands.

loans.use: to increase her inventory levels and thereby sell greater quantities of food.

loans.name: Maribel

texts.en:
As a married parent of six children, Maribel works hard to support her family.

She has a business buying and selling dry goods in the Philippines, and she also earns income from raising livestock. Maribel is borrowing PHP 12,000 through NWTF to buy more stocks of dry goods to sell in her business.

Maribel has sustained her business activities through her past four loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of building and expanding her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy more stocks of dry goods to sell

loans.name: Feliciana

texts.en:
Feliciana works hard to support her family. Feliciana is married and has a tricycle transport business in the Philippines.

Feliciana requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to purchase spare parts and tools for the maintenance of her tricycle.

Feliciana has been in this business for 7 years now.

Feliciana would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase spare parts and tools for the maintenance of her tricycle

loans.name: Marina

texts.en:
Marina works hard to support her family. Marina is widowed and has a business buying and selling eggs in the Philippines.

Marina requested a PHP 13,000 loan through NWTF to buy more eggs to sell to her customers.

Marina has been in this business for 10 years now.

In the future, Marina would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to school.

loans.use: to buy more eggs to sell to her customers

loans.name: Marissa

texts.en:
Marissa is 30 years old and has three children. Marissa is married and all three children are in school.

Marissa is in the agricultural business, raising pigs in the Philippines. Marissa requested a PHP 13,000 loan through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Marissa has been raising pigs for 11 years now and has borrowed 4 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Marissa would like to save enough to build a house for her family.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Nurzat

texts.ru: Нурзат 34 года, не замужем. У Нурзат- среднее образование, в качестве основного дохода Нурзат занимается животноводством, стартовав 9 лет назад, с покупки скота на 20,000 сом KGS. Благодаря упорному труду Нурзат, в ее хозяйстве на сегодняшний день имеется: 4 дойные коровы, 2 лошади, 25 овец. Ежемесячный доход составляет 6,000 сом (KGS). В целях дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, Нурзат обратилась в Микрофинансовый банк «Бай –Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 100,000 сом (KGS) на покупку коров для увеличения поголовья скота. Доходы от кредита Нурзат планирует вложить в дальнейшее приумножение количества домашней скотины, и планирует накопить средства на ремонт дома.
texts.en:
Nurzat is 34 years old and not married. She has secondary education. As her main income, Nurzat works with livestock breeding, after having started nine years ago with the purchase of livestock for 20,000 som (KGS). Thanks to Nurzat's persistent work, her farm currently consists of four dairy cows, two horses and 25 sheep. The monthly income is 6,000 som (KGS). 

With an aim to further develop her business, Nurzat turned to the microfinance bank "Bai Tushum & Partners" for a loan in the amount of 100,000 for the purchase of cows to increase the number of livestock. Nurzat plans to invest the income from the loan in further increasing the number of household animals, and to save money for repairing her house.

loans.use: to purchase cows

loans.name: Agnes

texts.en:
Agnes is married and has five children. Her husband is a security guard. 

Although she has received no formal education, Agnes is an entrepreneur. She specializes in selling onions and food in Beahu, which is near Takoradi. She has been involved in this enterprise for five years. 

The proceeds from her business normally go towards helping her husband cover the family’s general expenses and pay their children’s school fees. Agnes wants to use her loan to increase her current inventory levels, which will allow her to sell greater quantities of onions and food. In the long term, Agnes plans to reinvest future profits into her business, thus helping her business expand and meet rising customer demand.

loans.use: to increase her current inventory
